Policy: Decree No. 4.377 enacting the 1979 Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women.
Policy_Content: This Decree enacts for the National legislation the 1979 Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW). Considering that the National Congress approved, by Legislative Decree No. 93 of 14 November 1983, the CEDAW, signed by the Federative Republic of Brazil, in New York, on 31 March 1981; Considering that the Convention entered into force for Brazil, on 2 March 1984, it is decreed that the CEDAW will be implemented and enforced in full. The Convention states that the States Parties condemn discrimination against women in all its forms, agree to pursue by all appropriate means and without delay a policy of eliminating discrimination against women and, to this end, undertake: (a) To embody the principle of the equality of men and women in their national constitutions or other appropriate legislation if not yet incorporated therein and to ensure, through law and other appropriate means, the practical realization of this principle; (b) To adopt appropriate legislative and other measures, including sanctions where appropriate, prohibiting all discrimination against women; (c) To establish legal protection of the rights of women on an equal basis with men and to ensure through competent national tribunals and other public institutions the effective protection of women against any act of discrimination; (d) To refrain from engaging in any act or practice of discrimination against women and to ensure that public authorities and institutions shall act in conformity with this obligation; (e) To take all appropriate measures to eliminate discrimination against women by any person, organization or enterprise; (f) To take all appropriate measures, including legislation, to modify or abolish existing laws, regulations, customs and practices which constitute discrimination against women; (g) To repeal all national penal provisions which constitute discrimination against women.
Subject: General

Policy: Water Management Law (2002)
Policy_Content: This Law provides for water management in Latvia. Its purposes include (1) to establish such a system for the protection and management of surface water and groundwater which (a) facilitates sustainable and rational use of water resources, ensuring long-term protection thereof and sufficient supply to inhabitants with good quality surface water and groundwater, (b) prevents the deterioration of water and the state of the terrestrial ecosystems and wetlands directly dependant on water, protects such ecosystems and improves the condition thereof, (c) improves the protection of the aquatic environment, gradually reduces emission and discharge of priority substances, as well as phases out emission and discharge of substances, which are especially hazardous to the aquatic environment, (d) ensures progressive reduction of pollution of groundwater and prevents further pollution thereof, (e) ensures the replenishment of groundwater resources, (f) ensures the protection of land against flooding or droughts,  (g) ensures the protection of the marine waters of Latvia, and (h) facilitates the achievement of the objectives specified in international agreements in order to eliminate and prevent the pollution of the marine environment, eliminate or progressively eliminate emission and discharge of substances especially hazardous to the aquatic environment in the marine environment, and to achieve such a situation where the concentrations of chemical substances of anthropogenic origin are close to zero, but the concentration of naturally occurring chemical substances is close to the naturally existing background level; and (2) to establish a system for the assessment and management of flood risk to reduce the adverse consequences for human health, the environment, cultural heritage and economic activity associated with a flood event. The Law further provides for river basin districts and administrative institutions thereof; environmental quality objectives; economic analysis of use of water resources and the fee for using water resources; management plan and programme of measures of river basin district; permits for use of water resources and monitoring conditions; provision of information to the public, other countries and the European Commission; and procedures for implementation, supervision and appeal of requirements of the law.

Policy: Decreto Nº 94 - Ley de Derechos y Cultura Indígena del Estado de México.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Estado de México reconoce y regula los derechos de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas y originarias, asentadas de manera continua en localidades y municipios de la entidad. Entre los derechos reconocidos se contemplan los relacionados con la tierra (arts. 46-49) y con el aprovechamiento de los recursos naturales (arts. 50-57). Se establece que los pueblos y las comunidades indígenas tienen el derecho de decidir las propias prioridades en lo que atañe al proceso de desarrollo, en la medida en que éste afecte a sus vidas, creencias, instituciones y bienestar espiritual y a las tierras que ocupan o utilizan de alguna manera, y de controlar, en lo posible, su propio desarrollo económico, social y cultural en el contexto del Plan de Desarrollo del Estado de México (art. 21). Asimismo se introducen disposiciones específicas para la mujer indígena y su desarrollo integral (arts. 70-82).
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Decision of the Government of Romania on the approval of the criteria for the delimitation of mountain areas.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Government specified criteria for the delimitation of “mountain areas” in the sense of the Mountain Law. Mountain areas are areas where use of lands is costly due to the climatic conditions determined by altitudes of more than six-hundred metres, or, on lower altitudes of slopes of more than twenty degrees, slopes that are to steep for agricultural use or require expensive equipment for proper use. Land may also be classified as mountain area if there exists a combination of factors mentioned above where the disadvantage of each factor combined is less serious, but the combination of the factors results in an equivalent disadvantage. Article 2 requires the Minister of Agriculture to issue, within six months, an Order for the delimitation of mountain areas at municipal and component village level. The delimitation of mountain areas shall be registered in agricultural books of municipalities in mountain areas and to be transposed in specialized land improvement plans. (2 articles)

Policy: Law No. 8934 on environmental protection.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the framework on environmental protection, which aims at: (a) the rational use of natural resources; (b) the prevention of environmental damage and, when necessary, the rehabilitation and restoration of damaged environment; and (c) the international cooperation in the field of environmental protection. Environmental protection shall be based upon the following principles: (a) sustainable development; (b) precaution; (c) prevention; (d) polluter-pays; (e) environmental damage repairing, recovery and regeneration; (f) liability; (g) high level protection; (h) integration of environmental protection in sector policies; (i) public awareness and participation in environmental decision-making; (j) transparency. The environment is defined as the entity of interactions between biotic and non biotic elements, which enhance the life on earth, including the natural biophysical environment of air, soil, water, diversity of biologic ecosystems, human health, and values of cultural, scientific and social heritage.

Policy: Law No. 11.829 providing for the State Policy on Cooperatives within the State of Rio Grande do Sul.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting 22 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes the State Policy on Cooperatives within the State of Rio Grande do Sul. This Policy establishes that Cooperative societies shall be those that are duly registered with the legal organs under the terms of the federal and pertinent legislation. The cooperatives must be constituted in accordance with the pertinent federal legislation. The objectives of the cooperatives will be those defined in their respective statutes, according to the federal legislation. The cooperative societies must be registered with the Commercial Board of the State of Rio Grande do Sul and registered with the state farm organs. The Board of Trade shall require, at the time of registration, a certificate issued by competent authority called OCERGS. The Commercial Board of the State of Rio Grande do Sul shall adopt a simplified regime for registration of cooperatives, eliminating documents that may be considered inopportune and unnecessary. The registration of the cooperatives in the state tax bodies is obligatory with the issuance of respective registration.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 361 validating the Regulation on the procedure for classifying waterways as navigable, and rules for operation thereof.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree defines the main tasks and duties of the inland water transport authorities on the classification of waterways and the rules for operation thereof. It applies to all navigable rivers, lakes and artificial waterways located on the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan. This procedure applies to border waterways when concluding a contract, agreements of the Republic of Tajikistan with foreign countries. Vessels navigating inland waterways of the Republic of Tajikistan shall be allowed to fly the flag of the Republic of Tajikistan. The list of rivers and lakes in which vessels are allowed to navigate is determined by the Ministry of Transport of the Republic of Tajikistan together with the Ministry of Land Reclamation and Water Management of the Republic of Tajikistan and is coordinated with the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan. All inland waterways are public routes. Internal waterways and navigable waterworks located on them are owned by the Republic of Tajikistan and are used for navigation by any legal entities and natural persons. Type and means of navigation equipment and the terms of their work, guaranteed dimensions of the vessels, the terms of operation of navigable waterworks are established by the Ministry of Transport and the Ministry of Land Reclamation and Water Management of the Republic of Tajikistan. It shall be prohibited to use the coastal strip for economic and other activities if such activities are incompatible with ensuring the safety of navigation.

Policy: Law No. 405-II amending Law No.754 – XII on nature protection.
Policy_Content: Article 22 shall acquire a new wording: “Article 22. Conditions of waste management. Waste management shall be carried out in accordance with the modalities established by the legislation. Owners of waste shall be responsible for waste management complying with environment. Local governmental bodies shall make decisions regarding location of waste disposal sites.” Article 45 shall acquire a new wording: “Article 45. Environmental protection against pollution by waste. Storage and management of waste on land of inhabited areas, protected areas, recreational areas, lands of historical and cultural heritage, water conservation and sanitary protection zones and other areas that can represent life and health risks for the population shall be prohibited. Burial of waste in the subsoil shall be authorized in exceptional cases after the outcome of special studies with the observance of requirements for the protection of human life and health, environmental protection and conservation of natural resources. Processing, burial and storage of waste on ranges shall be carried out in accordance with special authorization issued by the authorized state environmental institution.” Article 46 shall acquire a new wording: “Article 46. Ecological certification. Use of raw materials, application of technological processes and release of products (including foodstuffs) without ecological or hygienic certificates or not complying with the established parameters shall be prohibited. Ecological certification shall be applicable in cases envisaged by the legislation. The modalities of ecological certification shall be validated by the Cabinet of Ministers of Uzbekistan.”

Policy: Regional Law No. 85-OZ “On proclamation of the plot of pine plantations state nature monument of regional significance “Geographical species of common pine” and validation Regulation thereon”.
Policy_Content: The Governor decrees to proclaim plot of pine plantations in Kovrov district state nature monument of regional significance “Geographical species of common pine”. In order to prevent negative anthropogenic impact from the use of the territories adjacent to the nature monument, on the plantation of geographic pine species, a protection zone 25 m wide shall be established. The area of protected zone shall be 6.5 hectares. The main objectives of the formation of the state natural monument “Geographical species of common pine” shall be as follows:  (a) preservation of the forest species of common pine (Pinus sylvestris), grown from seed material obtained from different regions of Russia and neighboring states; (b) scientific monitoring of the state of plantations of geographical species of common pine; (c)  protection of biological resources on the territory of the nature monument; (d) preservation of the integrity of the established plant communities and the ecological balance; and (e) environmental education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area: (a) all types of felling, except for sanitary felling and thinning; (b) collection of soft resin; (c) commercial, sport and artisanal hunting; (d) industrial harvesting and gathering of mushrooms, berries, seeds, fruits, nuts, medicinal and other plants; (e) application of pesticides, mineral fertilizers, chemical plant protection products and growth stimulants; (f) measures to change the species composition of the flora and fauna of the nature monument; (g) hydrotechnical amelioration and irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (h) allotment of land plots for construction, as well as for horticulture, gardening and non-profit associations of citizens on the territory of the nature monument; (i) harvesting of hay, transfer of haymaking areas to pastures, grazing and passage of cattle; (j) plowing up land; (k) parking of cars, motorcycles outside public roads, washing cars and tractors on the territory of the monument of nature; (l) construction of buildings and structures, laying of new roads and pipelines, power lines and other utilities on the territory of the nature monument; (m) collection of botanical, zoological collections; (n)  organization of rest areas, bivouacs, tourist stations, camps and making fires; and (o) any other type of economic activity, recreational activity and other categories of nature management that could have a negative impact on the geographic common pine tree plantations.

Regulation on licensing of activity on transportation through main pipe-lines of oil, gas and their derivates determines the modalities of licensing of transportation of the aforementioned products and includes all technological processes and operations related to such activity. Regulation on licensing of activity of storage of oil, gas and their derivates determines the modalities of licensing of activity of storage of oil, gas and their derivates carried out by legal persons and individual entrepreneurs and includes pouring in, storage, discharge of oil and its derivates, and operations inside storage facilities. Regulation on licensing of activity of processing of oil, gas and their derivates determines the modalities of licensing of activity of processing of oil, gas and their derivates carried out by legal persons and individual entrepreneurs and includes manufacturing of oil products conforming to standards and technical requirements. Regulation on licensing of activity of trade of oil, gas and their derivates determines the modalities of licensing of trade of oil, gas and their derivates carried out by legal persons and individual entrepreneurs and includes wholesale and retail trade. Licensing authority for all types of activity specified in the present Ministerial Decree is the Ministry of Energy of the Russian Federation.

Policy: Law on Environmental Impact Assessments in Saxony-Anhalt
Policy_Content: The Law on Environmental Impact Assessments in Saxony-Anhalt regulates specific project plans and only applies to projects listed in the Annex. These specific project plans are marked either as obligatory environmental impact assessment project plans, as general preliminary examinations on an individual case-by-case basis in accordance with the law, or as location-related preliminary examinations on an individual case-by-case basis in accordance with the EIA law. The state is entitled to add new project plans to the list in the Annex through enactment of a regulation, where projects may have significant impacts on the environment due to their nature, scope or size (§ 1, (2)1.). Policy: Regulation No. 365 on utilisation, monitoring and control of sewage sludge and the compost thereof.
Policy_Content: These Regulation prescribes the procedures for the utilisation, monitoring and control of sewage sludge and the compost thereof. Sewage sludge is colloidal sediment resulting from the treating of municipal, domestic and industrial sewage in treatment plants, as well as depositions from septic tanks and other similar plants for sewage treatment. Sewage sludge compost is a decomposition product of sewage sludge and various materials of plant origin (peat, leaves, straw, saw dust and other landfill materials) that has been obtained as the result of a human impact on active microbiological activity. The Regulation consists of 12 Sections that contain 102 issues. Section 1 (issues 1-4) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (issues 5-14) regards determination of quality of sewage sludge and the compost thereof. Section 3 (issues 15-23) regards temporary storage of sewage sludge and the compost thereof at a place of utilisation. Section 4 (issues 24-47) regards utilisation of sewage sludge and the compost thereof for soil fertilization of agricultural lands. Section 5 (issues 48-61) regards utilisation of sewage sludge compost in forestry. Section 6 (issues 62-70) regards utilisation of sewage sludge and the compost thereof for greening of territories. Section 7 (issues 71-83) regards utilisation of sewage sludge and the compost thereof for recovery of degraded areas. Section 8 (issues 84-90) regards utilisation and burial of sewage sludge and the compost thereof in municipal waste landfill sites and dumps. Section 9 (issues 91-95) regards environmental monitoring of utilisation of sewage sludge and the compost thereof. Section 10 (issues 96-100) regards records of produced mass, quality and utilisation of sewage sludge. Section 11 (issue 101) regards control. Section 12 (issue 102) lays down closing provisions.

Policy: Loi n° 2002-22 du 16 août 2002 portant Code de la marine marchande.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a trait au Code de la Marine marchande et est applicable à tous les navires immatriculés au Sénégal, aux équipages et aux passagers qui y sont embarqués ainsi qu’à toutes les personnes, quelle que soit leur nationalité qui, bien que non présentes à bord, auraient commis une infraction aux dispositions du présent code ou de ses textes d’application, sans préjudice toutefois des dispositions particulières d’accords internationaux. Elle n’est pas applicable aux navires battant pavillon étranger sauf dispositions expresses contraires citées par le présent code. Le Titre II du livre I fixe les conditions générales de la navigation maritime, notamment l’organisation administrative et territoriale (mer territoriale, zone contiguë, zone économique exclusive, et le plateau continental); la classification et police de la navigation maritime (classification administrative la navigation de pêche comporte trois zones: pêche côtière; pêche au large; grande pêche.). Le livre III régit le statut du navire tant administratif (individualisation et nationalité; immatriculation et nom; marques extérieures d’identité-pavillon) que juridique (droits réels sur le navire: propriété du navire, opérations juridiques sur le navire).

Policy: Plant Health (Phytophthora ramorum) Order (Northern Ireland) 2002 (S.R. No. 269 of 2002).
Policy_Content: This Order implements measures to prevent the introduction and spread of the pest Phytophthora ramorum, a fungus which is not established in the United Kingdom. It regulates the importation and movement into and within Northern Ireland of plant material identified as susceptible to the pest, believed to cause Sudden Oak Death syndrome in certain species of oak in the USA, and harm to Rhododendron, Viburnum and other plants. This Order restricts the importation of a number of plant genera, including Rhododendron and Viburnum directly from the USA by requiring that such imports be accompanied by a phytosanitary certificate which confirms that the material originates from a location which is officially recognised in the USA as free from the pest.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 659 validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of regional significance “Chanovsky”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “Chanovsky” shall be classified as complex biological reserve constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of economically valuable rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species, natural habitats thereof, with a view of conservation and reproduction of living organisms valuable from economic, scientific and aesthetic point of view. Protected natural area of regional significance shall be organized for an unlimited period of time for the following purposes: (a) conservation of natural complexes and objects of forest steppe areas of Baraby in a natural state; (b) conservation, reproduction and restoration of natural resources, enrichment of adjoining land areas used for economic activities; (c) protection of migration routes, places of mass nesting and gathering of waterfowl and wetlands game, mating grounds of roe deer and other wild fauna species; (d) protection of wintering grounds of roe deer; (e) protection of natural habitats of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (f) maintaining the required hydrological regime; (g) maintenance of ecological balance and stability of functioning of ecosystems; and (h) provision of environmental education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) commercial, sport, artisanal hunting and other form of wildlife management; (b) all types of fisheries except for artisanal and sport fishing by local residents; (c) all types of felling except for sanitary felling; (d) destruction of forest outliers by any economic activity; (e) harvesting and procurement of non-timber forest products, except for procurement and collection of twigs for fodder and harvesting of spruce and other coniferous tree species for New Year holidays); (f) procurement of edible non-timber products and medicinal plants except for procurement thereof by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) cultivation of forest fruit bearing, ornamental and medicinal plant species; (i) use of forests for wood processing; (j) application and storage of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients; (k) haymaking, grazing and passage of cattle outside specially allotted areas; (l) destruction or removal from natural environment of endangered plant species and mushrooms; (m) ploughing up of the territory; (n) destruction of nidifugous burrows, except for harmful animals; (o) devastation of nests and collection of eggs (except for crows); (p) drainage and irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (q) burning of vegetation; (r) blasting operations; (s) water logging, construction of water reservoirs and other artificial waterbodies, and construction of waterworks; (t) allotment of land plots for construction, collective gardening and horticulture; (u) release and acclimatization of alien species; (u) zoological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (v) recreational activities; (w) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs; (x) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access; (y) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons; and (z) stay with unleashed dogs outside residential areas, sharpening and training of hunting dogs.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 422 on rules regarding expropriation and concession of the plots of land.
Policy_Content: The present Decree establishes rules as to expropriation and concession of the plots of land of all categories irrespectively of the kind of land tenure, lifelong hereditary possession, private ownership or lease. The plots of land shall be allotted in conformity with the project of the appropriate allotment thereof. Legal persons, natural persons and citizens interested in the allotment of the plots of land for agricultural commodity production, farming, and subsidiary small-holding, mowing and grazing must submit an application to the  local self-government. The application must specify the kind of tenure requested in regard of a plot of land, and also indicate the size and the location thereof, the area of all the plots of land that have been already allotted to the applicant and, in case of mowing and grazing, the total number and specification of animals owned by the applicant. The application for the concession of the plot of land for farming must contain also business plan. The development of the allotment project and the terms and conditions thereof shall be governed by the contract  between the applicant and the land surveying organization. The application for the allotment of the plot of land shall be examined by the local self-government within a month from the date the application. The amount of compensation for the damage caused by the expropriation of the plots of land shall be calculated in conformity with the legislation currently in force.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regulation on the instances in which practices involving the risk of exposure to ionizing radiation are not subject to the licensing or reporting requirement, and instances in which the said practices may be conducted based on a report.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation of the Council of Ministers, which is composed of five paragraphs, establishes: instances in which practices involving the risk of exposure to ionizing radiation, hereinafter referred to as exposure, are not subject to the licensing or reporting requirement; instances in which practices involving the risk of exposure may be conducted based on a report; maximum values of total activity and concentration of radioactive isotopes as a criterion required for the release from the licensing or reporting requirement. In particular a subject to the licensing or reporting requirement is manufacture, processing, turnover, storage, transport and application of materials, raw materials and waste, in particular mineral raw materials, artificial fertilizers, clay, ash, slag and mining deposits containing natural radioactive isotopes.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 15393/2332 on the classification of public and private works and projects into categories, in compliance with Law No. 1650/1986 as amended by article 1 of Law No. 3010/2002.
Policy_Content: The Decree aims at implementing the provisions of article 3 of Law No. 1650/86 as amended by article 1 of Law No. 3010/2002. It also aims at complying with article 1 of Council Directive 96/61 and article 1 of Council Directive 97/11/EC so as to ensure that the assessment of environmental effects of certain public and private projects and works contributes to the prevention of environmental pollution (article 1). Article 2 establishes that the provisions of this Decree shall apply to all public or private projects and works falling under categories (A) and (B) of Law No. 1650/86. Exempted from this rule are those projects which serve national security. In article 3 and 4 such works and projects are clustered into groups (ten per each category) and are listed down in Annex I to this Decree.

Policy: Resolution on the establishment of the Pakistan Horticulture Development and Export Board.
Policy_Content: This Resolution provides for the establishment of the Pakistan Horticulture Development and Export Board. Functions and powers of the Board shall include: formulation of a National Horticulture Policy; development of horticulture export marketing strategies; promotion of technological upgrading and human resource development; design and implementation of quality standards for exports; improvement of research, production and marketing in the field of horticulture. The Board shall also be competent to make rules relating to grading, quarantine and SPS standards for horticulture exports. The Board shall be subject to the superintendence and control of the Federal Government.

Policy: Arrêté du 5 août 2002 portant répartition entre les départements d'outre-mer du contingent relatif à l'aide concernant la transformation de la canne à sucre en rhum agricole.
Policy_Content: Conformément à l'article 17 du règlement n° 1452/2001 du Conseil du 28 juin 2001 et à l'article 4 du règlement n° 738/2002 du 29 avril 2002 de la Commission, les quantités globales bénéficiant de l'aide relative à la transformation de la canne à sucre en rhum agricole s'élèvent à 75 600 hectolitres d'alcool pur. Ce contingent de 75 600 hectolitres d'alcool pur est réparti entre les quatre départements d'outre-mer en fonction de la quantité moyenne de rhum agricole écoulée au cours des années 1997 à 2001 en retranchant les chiffres de la meilleure campagne et ceux de la moins bonne. Les bénéficiaires de l'aide sont les producteurs de rhum agricole tel qu'il est défini dans le règlement (CEE) n° 1576/89 du Conseil du 29 mai 1989, à savoir une eau de vie issue exclusivement de la fermentation alcoolique et de la distillation du jus de canne à sucre, présentant les caractères aromatiques spécifiques du rhum et ayant une teneur en substances volatiles égale ou supérieure à 225 grammes par hectolitre d'alcool à 100 % vol.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean

Policy: Regional Law No. 48-Z “On subsoil management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations related to mining, management of mining waste, peat, groundwater and other specific mineral resources. It shall be applicable to subsoil parcels containing solid minerals, including widespread minerals, and subsoil parcels used for purposes non-related to exploration and mining. State supervision over subsoil management shall be carried out with a view of law enforcement. Subsoil parcels shall be conceded for exploration and mining in the form of mining allotment in accordance with licence. Regional administration shall appoint mining licensing authority. Amount of payment for subsoil management shall be established in cadastre valuation of land.

Policy: Decree No. 49 of the Federal Mining and Industrial Survey validating the Regulation on coordination of project documentation for subsoil management.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of coordination of project documentation for construction, re-construction, liquidation and conservation mining facilities for extraction and processing of minerals. Federal Mining and Industrial Survey shall coordinate mining projects in the following cases: (a) test operation of boreholes exceeds 1 year and test operation of raw hydrocarbon deposits exceeds 3 years; (b) experimental mining exceeds 5 years; and (c) project documentation was submitted directly to the Federal Mining and Industrial Survey. In the process of project documentation examination the following criteria shall be taken into consideration: (a) prevention of negative environmental impact; (b) compliance with mining licensing terms and conditions; and (c) positive conclusion state industrial safety expertise.

Policy_Content: The Regulations amend Schedule 1 to the Antarctic Regulations 1995 by adding further restricted areas and by modifying the description of one restricted area, to give effect to Measure 1(2000) of the Twelfth Special Antarctic Treaty Consultative Meeting (The Hague, 2000) and amend Schedule 2 by adding two further historic sites to give effect to Measures 1(2001) and 2(2001) of the Twenty-fifth Antarctic Treaty Consultative Meeting (St. Petersburg, 2001). Policy: Resolution laying down the environmental action strategy for sustainable development in Italy.
Policy_Content: By adopting this Resolution, the Interministerial Committee for Economic Programming has approved the document containing the “Environmental Action Strategy for Sustainable Development in Italy 2002-2010”. The document is entirely contained in the Annex attached to the Resolution and it is divided into the following seven Chapters: (1) The Italian Environmental Action Programme; (2) Environmental action instruments (enforcement of legislation in force, environmental impact assessment, tax system, technical and scientific research); (3) Climate and atmosphere (climate change, ozone layer); (4) Nature and biodiversity (biotechnology, soil conservation, desertification, marine and coastal environments); (5) Environmental quality and life quality in urban environments (food safety, genetically modified organisms, air quality); (6) Sustainable use of natural resources and waste management (water resources, waste); (7) Monitoring on the environmental action for sustainable development. In accordance with article 4 of the Resolution, the Ministry of the Environment shall transmit annually to the Interministerial Committee a report dealing with the implementation status of the Strategy hereby laid down.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la aprobación de los planes de uso del suelo de los Departamentos de Chuquisaca, Beni, Potosí y Tarija. Cada plan de uso del suelo está compuesto por los siguientes documentos: a) un mapa del "Plan de Uso del Suelo" basado en la zonificación agroecológica y socioeconómica; b) las reglas de intervención, las reglas de uso y recomendaciones de manejo del plan de uso de los Departamentos, para cada una de las categorías y subcategorías de uso del suelo; c) la matriz de reglas de uso según las unidades consignadas en las categorías y subcategorías mencionadas. Las seis categorías generales de uso del suelo son las siguientes: 1) tierras de uso agropecuario intensivo; 2) tierras de uso agropecuario extensivo; 3) tierras de uso agrosilvopastoril; 4) tierras de uso forestal; 5) tierras de uso restringido; 6) áreas naturales protegidas. El capítulo V define el marco institucional y regulatorio. En virtud de lo dispuesto por el artículo 14, se respetan, en el marco de las leyes vigentes, los derechos de propiedad, concesiones forestales y de tierras comunitarias de origen, adquiridos por los particulares, comunidades y pueblos indígenas originarios, así como de entidades públicas, con anterioridad a la vigencia de los Planes de Uso del Suelo de Chuquisaca, Beni, Potosí y Tarija.

Policy: Act on Protection against Ionizing Radiation and Nuclear Safety.
Policy_Content: The purposes of this Act are to protect human health and the environment from detrimental effects of ionising radiations, regulate the implementation of nuclear safety measures and determine the organization of the administrative bodies. The Act is divided into 16 Parts. Part 1 gives definitions, basic principles of the Act, and provides for the appointment of expert councils. Part 2 sets out provisions for obtaining permits to carry out practices involving radiation and to use radiation sources. Part 3 provides for the protection of people against ionising radiation, obligatory measures related to dose limits, measures aimed at reducing radiation exposure in the workplace, etc. Part 4 deals with radiation and nuclear safety in facilities, which shall be classified into nuclear facilities, radiation facilities and less important radiation facilities. A permit must be issued by the ministry responsible for the environment for the construction, reconstruction or removal of a facility. Provisions are set out for handling radioactive waste and spent fuel (arts. 93 to 99), and for the import, export and transit of nuclear waste and spent fuel (arts. 100 to 103). Part 5 deals with the issuing, renewal, amendment, withdrawal and expiry of permits. Measures for physical protection of nuclear substances and nuclear facilities are provided for in Part 6. Part 7 deals with the non-proliferation of nuclear weapons and the protection of nuclear materials. The monitoring of radioactivity levels in the environment shall be ensured by ministries responsible for the environment, air, waters, health, foodstuffs, animal feed, etc. as provided for in Part 8. The remaining Parts of the Act deal with the following: reports on protection against radiation; records containing information on radiation sources and practices involving radiation; financing of the protection against ionising radiation and nuclear safety; compensation for the limited use of land due to a nuclear facility; administrative tasks and inspectorate control; and, penal provisions.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Le présent règlement a pour objectifs: a) d'établir des valeurs limites pour les concentrations de benzène et de monoxyde de carbone dans l'air ambiant; b) d'évaluer les concentrations desdits polluants dans l'air ambiant sur base de méthodes et de critères communs; c) d'acquérir des informations appropriées sur les concentrations desdits polluants dans l'air ambiant et d'assurer que les informations sont communiquées au public; d) de préserver la qualité de l'air ambiant, là où elle est bonne, et de l'améliorer dans les autres cas eu égard à la présence desdits polluants. Le texte comprend 12 articles comme suit: Champ d’application et objectifs (art. 1er); Définitions (art. 2); Annexes (art. 3); Benzène (art. 4); Monoxyde de carbone (art. 5); Évaluation des concentrations (art. 6); Information du public (art. 7); Entrée en vigueur (art. 8); Exécution (art. 9). Sept annexes sont jointes.

Policy: Ghana Maritime Authority Act, 2002 (Act 630).

Policy: Commission Decision 2002/623/EC establishing guidance notes supplementing Annex II to Directive 2001/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms and repealing Council Directive 90/220/EEC
Policy_Content: The guidance notes set out in the Annex to this Decision shall be used as a supplement to Annex II to Directive 2001/18/EC on the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms. The deliberate release and the placing on the market of genetically modified organisms are subject to prior explicit consent to be given only upon previous environmental risk assessment. The Annex hereby attached lays down guidance notes on the objective, elements, general principles and methodology of such environmental risk assessment. The objective of the environmental risk assessment is primarily to identify and evaluate potential adverse effects of the genetically modified organisms, direct or indirect, immediate or delayed, on human health and the environment which the deliberate release or placing on the market of genetically modified organisms may have.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants

Policy: Federal Law No. 101-FZ on turnover of agricultural land.
Policy_Content: The present Federal Law regulates relations connected with ownership, land tenure and disposal of the plots of agricultural land, sets use restrictions applicable to transactions with the plots and shares in common property of agricultural land out of which land rights shall originate or cease, determines the terms and conditions of allotment of the plots of agricultural land pertaining to public or municipal property, and also the modalities of expropriation thereof for public and municipal needs. The provisions of the present Federal Law are not applicable to the plots of agricultural land allotted to citizens for personal subsidiary small-holding, gardening, truck farming and animal breeding. The turnover of agricultural land shall be based on the following principles: (a) preservation of specific use of land plots; (b) setting the maximum size of the total area of agricultural land, located within the same municipal area that may be owned by one citizen and/or one legal entity; (c) preferential right of a constituent entity of the Russian Federation or in cases, established by the law, of a municipal unit for purchase of a plot of agricultural land when it is sold, except in cases of public sale; (d) preferential right of other participants of share ownership to land parcel or using land parcel of agricultural organization or a citizen who is a member peasant farms to purchase a share in the common ownership in the event of a compensatory disposition of such interest by the participant of shared ownership; and (e) establishment of particulars of granting agricultural land plots to foreign nationals, foreign legal persons, stateless persons, as well as legal entities, in the statutory (share) to the capital of which the share of foreign citizens, foreign legal entities or stateless persons is more than 50 percent.The Federal Law consists of 4 Sections composed of 20 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-7) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 8-11) specifies the particulars of turnover of the plots of agricultural land. Section 3 (arts. 12-14) establishes the particulars of turnover shares in common property to agricultural land. Section 4 (arts. 15-20) lays down transitional and final provisions.

Policy: Agricultural Holdings (Units of Production) (England) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 1925 of 2002).
Policy_Content: This Order prescribes units of production for the assessment of the productive capacity of agricultural land. An assessment of the productive capacity of agricultural land is required in determining whether or not the land in question is a "commercial unit of agricultural land" for the purposes of the succession provisions in the Agricultural Holdings Act 1986. A "commercial unit of agricultural land" is land which, when farmed under competent management, is capable of producing a net annual income which is not less than the aggregate of the average annual earnings of two full-time male agricultural workers aged 20 years or over (par. 3 of Schedule 6 to the 1986 Act).

Policy: Decision No. 1600/2002/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down the Sixth Community Environment Action Programme.
Policy_Content: This Decision sets forth at the Community level a programme of action on the environment, establishing the key environmental objectives to be attained. Such objectives shall respond to the key environmental priorities to be met by the Community in the following areas: (a) climate change; (b) nature and biodiversity; (c) environment and health and quality of life; (d) natural resources and wastes. The programme shall be implemented in accordance with the polluter-pays principle, the precautionary principle as well as the principle of rectification of pollution at source (art. 2, paragraph 1). A detailed article specifying the objectives and priorities to be taken into account is devoted to each area: article 5 refers to climate change; article 6 deals with nature and biodiversity; article 7 concerns environment and health as well as quality of life; article 8 regards the sustainable use and management of natural resources and wastes.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pollution control,Climate change,Environmental planning,Ozone layer,Polluter pays principle,Precautionary principle,Waste prevention,Waste management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Freshwater resources management,Policy/planning,Biodiversity,Ecosystem preservation,GMO,Management/conservation

Policy: Law No. 133-Z “On state registration of immovable property and transactions therewith”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal grounds and the modalities of state registration of immovable property and restrictions (encumbrances) imposed thereon, and also transactions on the national territory and state protection of registered rights and restrictions (encumbrances) imposed on immovable property and transactions therewith. This Law shall be applicable, inter alia, to state registration of the plots of land, plots of subsoil and forests (Art. 3). The following rights and transactions shall be subject to mandatory state registration: (a) life-long hereditary possession of land; (b) permanent (open-ended) land tenure; (c) temporary land tenure; (d) lease of a plot of land; (e) servitude; (f) mortgage; (g) seizure; and (h) restriction (encumbrance) due to historical and cultural value of property (Art. 8). Unified state register of immovable property shall contain cadastre and maps (Art. 22).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Las normas se ajustan a las políticas nacionales de integración y complementación energética regional, así como la diversificación de las formas de energía disponibles para el desarrollo sustentable, con el mínimo impacto ambiental. Uno de los principales objetivos perseguidos es la protección del medio ambiente y la promoción de la conservación de energía, fomentando en particular la utilización del gas natural.

Policy: Loi n°02-049 d'orientation sur la santé.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de fixer les grandes orientations de la politique nationale de santé. La politique nationale de santé repose sur les principes fondamentaux d’équité, de justice, de solidarité, de participation de la population et de la société civile. Elle prend en compte les engagements internationaux auxquels la République du Mali a souscrit. Les  priorités  de  l’action  sanitaire  sont  réservées  à  la  prévention  des  maladies, à  la promotion sanitaire et au bien-être de la famille en milieu rural et périurbain ainsi qu’à l’amélioration de l’accès des populations les plus pauvres aux soins de santé.

Policy: Legislative Decree No.20 of 2002 on the regulation of fishing, exploitation and protection of marine wealth.
Policy_Content: This Royal Decree consisting of 38 articles divided in 6 Chapters aims to outline the overall legislative framework regulating the exploitation of fisheries and other marine resources and identify the responsibilities of the competent Authority. It establishes that (i) without prejudice to the special provisions concerning GCC nationals, non-nationals of the State of Bahrain are prohibited from practicing commercial fishing; (ii) without a license issued by the competent Authority (the Department of Fisheries and Marine Resources at the Ministry of Housing and Agriculture), commercial fishing in fishing waters may not be practiced; (iii) the license shall be limited in duration and indicate the specifications of the vessel, the fishing methods and equipment used, the number of crew members,  the locations of the vessel's work, the authorized fishing seasons and the types and quantities of marine wealth to be harvested in each region and in each season; (iv) in the case of commercial fishing, a Bahraini captain shall be required on board; (v) the Minister may grant to practice fishing for the purpose of carrying out research or scientific studies and, in that case, may exempt from the application of some provisions of this Decree.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Directive 2002/51/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the reduction of the level of pollutant emissions from two- and three-wheel motor vehicles and amending Directive 97/24/EC.
Policy_Content: This Directive aims at reducing the level of pollutant emissions from two or three-wheel motor vehicles by tightening the limit values for such emissions. From 1 April 2003, Member States shall refuse to grant the EC type-approval as per article 4 (1) of Directive 92/61/EEC for any kind of vehicle on grounds connected with the measures to be taken against air pollution, if that vehicle fails to comply with the provisions laid down in Directive 97/24/EC. Member States may provide for tax incentives only in respect of vehicles complying with the requirements established by Directive 97/24/EC. Chapter 5 of that Directive, fixing limit values for pollutants, is amended in accordance with the Annex to the present Directive.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Décret n°02-369 / p-rm du 19 juillet 2002 portant création des services régionaux et sub-régionaux de l’hydraulique et de l’énergie.

Ce service est chargée de:entreprendre toutes études en vue d’évaluer le potentiel hydraulique et énergétique, ainsi que les besoins;collecter, conserver, traiter et diffuser les informations sur les ressources hydrauliques et énergétiques; assister, coordonner et contrôler les différents intervenants et leurs activités dans les secteurs de l’eau et de l’énergie;élaborer des schémas directeurs régionaux d’aménagement des bassins fluviaux et d’approvisionnement en eau potable; procéder à l’étude, au contrôle, à la supervision et à la coordination des projets de réalisations des ouvrages hydrauliques d’évacuation des eaux usées et des eaux pluviales;apporter un appui-conseil aux collectivités territoriales dans l’élaboration, la recherche de financement et la mise en oeuvre de leurs programmes de réalisation d’infrastructures hydrauliques et énergétiques;faire connaître et appliquer les normes et la réglementation dans les secteurs de l’eau et de l’énergie; promouvoir les énergies de substitution et les économies d’énergie.

Toda la gasolina motor y el ACPM que se almacene, maneje, transporte y distribuya en el territorio nacional deberán estar marcados, y será responsabilidad de Ecopetrol determinar el procedimiento de "marcación" y el "marcador" (Sustancia química que permite obtener información sobre la procedencia del combustible), que se utilizará en todo el país, así como los procedimientos de "detección". Policy: Law No. LP1264/2002 “On the declaration and control of income and property of the public officials, judges, prosecutors, civil servants and some top executives.”

It establishes categories and ranks (positions) of the public officials for which declaration of income and property shall be mandatory and specifies the objects of declaration, in particular shall be subject to declaration either income and property on the national territory or abroad. Policy: Décret n° 2002-746 du 19 juillet 2002 relatif à la normalisation et au système de certification de la conformité aux normes.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe le cadre juridique du système national de normalisation et de la promotion de la qualité, ainsi que les procédures de leur élaboration et approbation, conformément aux dispositions nationales, régionales et internationales.  La normalisation a pour objet de fournir des documents de référence appelés normes devant contribuer à la solution des problèmes techniques et/ou commerciaux concernant les produits, biens et services qui se posent de façon répétée dans les relations entre partenaires économiques, scientifiques, techniques et sociaux. La  norme  est  une  spécification  technique  ou  autre  document  accessible  au  public,  établi  avec  la  coopération  et  le  consensus  ou  l’approbation  générale  de  toutes  les  parties  intéressées,  fondée  sur  les résultats  conjugués  de  la  science,  de  la  technologie  et  de  l’expérience,  visant  l’avantage  optimal  de  la  communauté  dans  son  ensemble  et  approuvé  par  un  organisme  qualifié  sur  le  plan  national,  régional  ou international. La certification consiste à attester au moyen d’un certificat et/ou d’une marque, qu’un produit ou un service est conforme à des normes ou à des spécifications techniques déterminées. Elle est faite par un organisme dûment habilité appelé organisme certificateur.

Policy: Law No. 3.031 providing for the Policy on Forestry of the Federal District State.
Policy_Content: This Law, based on arts. 23, 24 and 225 of the Federal Constitution and in art. 14 of Law No. 4.771 of 15 September 1965, regulates the preservation, conservation and use of forestry resources in the Federal District. It recognizes as Natural Heritage of the Federal District the Cerrado Biome, whose members are assets of the local community. The forests and other forms of native vegetation, urban and rural, existing in the Federal District, useful for the maintenance and conservation of the lands they cover, are considered as goods of common interest to all citizens, exercising their right of ownership and use with the limitations that the legislation establish. All the forestry formations, urban and rural, of the territory of the Federal District are under the protection of this Law. The objectives of the Policy on Forestry are: protect natural resources: flora, fauna, atmosphere, soil and water; develop the forest potential of the Federal District to: a) produce quality forestry raw material; b) rational use of the soil in the rural properties, according to its agro-silvopastoral capacity and within the limits allowed or established; c) stimulate for forest use the land used for non-competitive agricultural activities; d) provide raw materials and inputs necessary for economic activities and maintenance of the rural population; generate new job opportunities: a) make possible a new source of income generating activities; b) industrialization and commercialization of forestry raw material produced in the Federal District; encourage the planting and management of native and exotic forest species for economic, social and environmental purposes; promote the recovery of degraded areas through forest restoration through natural regeneration and reforestation; organize and diversify forestry activity in rural property; promote trainings on forestry; develop technical assistance and processing in forestry sector, etc.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Sulphur in Diesel Fuel Regulations (SOR/2002-254).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999. The purpose of the above-mentioned Regulations is to ensure that the level of sulphur in diesel fuel used in on-road vehicles in Canada will not impede the effective operation of advanced emission control technologies planned to be introduced on 2007 and later model year vehicles (i.e., in mid-2006) to comply with stringent new exhaust emission standards. This is accomplished by reducing the maximum allowable limit for sulphur in on-road diesel fuel to 15 milligrams per kilogram of the fuel, which is equivalent to 15 parts per million (p.p.m.), commencing 1 June 2006. The text consists of 8 sections as follows: Application (1); Maximum concentration of sulphur (2); Analysis (3); Reports (3); Records (4); Repeal (4); Coming into force (5). Two Schedules are enclosed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Water and Soil Pollution Control Law, 2002 (Law No. 106(I)/2002).
Policy_Content: In the process of harmonizing the Cypriot legislation with the environmental legislative framework of the European Union, this law sets forth the basic provisions for the protection of water resources and soil against polution. The law aims at protecting surface and underground waters and soil from human and industrial polluting activities and at controlling the disposal of liquid and solid industrial waste. Specific measures are prescribed for the prevention of pollution and the adoption of an overall approach in granting licenses to industrial plants and cattle breeding facilities that cause pollution of waters and soil. The law is divided in six parts. The first part includes introductive provisions and definitions. Also, sets out the duties of the Minister of Agriculture, Natural Resources and Environment. The second part refers to protection of waters and soil in general from nitrate pollution caused by agricultural activities, i.e. by the use of fertilizers, manure and recycled water in irrigation. The third part regulates all maters related to the process of issuing licenses for disposal of waste to existing and new (industrial and not) facilities that cause pollution by disposing waste in waters and soil. The fourth part introduces the concept of integrated prevention and control of pollution concerning large-scale industrial and animal breeding facilities which are considered largely responsible for environmental pollution. For the provisions of this Part, the corresponding European Directive itself includes a transitional period for waste disposal licensing to existing industrial facilities and swine houses, up to October 2007. The remaining two parts concern, administrative regulations and procedures, powers of inspectors, the keeping of a registry book for facilities to which waste disposal licenses are granted and the procedures for delivering information to the European Committee.

As envisaged by legislation, land use planning documentation shall be coordinated by the Federal Land Cadastre Service and its territorial branches, sanitary and epidemiological supervision bodies, entities involved in the protection of cultural monuments and local self-governments. The Federal Land Cadastre Service shall coordinate the following land use planning documentation: (a) general land use planning scheme of the territory of the Russian Federation; (b) land use planning documentation elaborated by governmental bodies; and (c) documentation related federal land. In certain cases, land use planning documentation shall be subject to state environmental audit and examination prior its validation. Land use planning documentation shall establish measures for the rational management and conservation of land. Le champ d’application du nouveau Code porte sur la prospection, la recherche, l’exploitation, la transformation, le transport et la commercialisation des substances minérales classées en mines ou en produits de carrières ainsi que sur l’exploitation artisanale des substances minérales et à la commercialisation de celles-ci. Policy: Regulation on the Principles and Implementation of Organic Farming.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth the principles to be followed for conducting organic farming, procedures for importation, organic product processing, packaging, labelling, storing and transportation. Locations where organic farming is not allowed are listed in the Regulation. Organic farming is based on contracted farming. Those who wish to be involved in organic farming shall apply to relevant controlling and/or certification entity. Eligible applicants will then conclude a contract with the controlling and/or certification entity. The entire procedure from application to contracting is given in detail. Contracted farmers are closely monitored during a "transitional stage". Products produced during that stage can only be sold by labelling as "organic farming transitional stage product" and cannot be sold as an organic product. The transition period is two years for annual plants and 3 years for perennial plants. Soil protection and preparation methods, fertilizing methods, planting methods, plant protection methods, irrigation methods, yielding methods are defined in detail. Rules for organic mushroom production, organic productions in glasshouses are also specified. Organic animal husbandry methods and organic aqua products are defined in the Regulation in detail. The Regulation also provides detailed information on processing, packaging, labelling, storing, transportation and marketing of organic products.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Countryside Access (Appeals Procedures) (Wales) Regulations 2002 (S.I. No. 1794 (W. 169 of 2002).
Policy_Content: Under sections 11, 32 and 38 of the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000, the National Assembly for Wales has the power to make regulations to provide the procedures to be followed in determining appeals brought under Part I of the Act. These Regulations will initially have effect in relation to appeals by persons against the showing of land, in which they have an interest, on a provisional map as open country or registered common land. It is intended that these Regulations will also form the basis of the procedures of other specified appeals under the Act. Part II (regs. 3 to 6) sets out the initial procedures which will have effect irrespective of whether the appeal is to be determined by exchange of written representations or following a hearing or public local inquiry. Part III (regs. 7 to 9) provides the procedures to be followed where a party to an appeal has chosen to have the appeal determined through an exchange of written representations. Part IV (regs. 10 to 16) provides the procedures to be followed where a party to an appeal has chosen for the appeal to be determined following a hearing. Part V (regs. 17 to 28) provides the procedures to be followed where a party to an appeal has chosen for the appeal to be determined following a public local inquiry. Part VI (regulations 29 to 36) sets out miscellaneous matters.

These Regulations make provision for the preparation and issue of maps in provisional and conclusive form. A provisional map is a map which was issued as a draft map in accordance with the Countryside Access (Draft Maps) (Wales) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/4001) (W.329), has been confirmed by the Countryside Council for Wales with or without modifications and has been issued in provisional form pursuant to section 5(d) or (e) of the Act. Regulation 3 sets out the procedures and requirements for the preparation of provisional maps by the Council. Regulation 4 establishes the procedures for the issue and publication of a provisional map. Regulation 5 requires the Council to publicise the provisions of provisional maps generally. Regulation 6 sets out the procedure by which a person seeking to bring an appeal against the showing of land as registered common land or open country on a provisional draft map must do so. Regulations 7 to 9 set out the procedures and requirements for the preparation, issue and publication of conclusive maps by the Council.

These Regulations make procedural provision, in relation to Wales, for appeals to the National Assembly for Wales by the owners or occupiers of sites of special scientific interest under: (a) section 28F of the 1981 Act, against a refusal by the Countryside Council for Wales, to consent to certain operations on the land, against the conditions attached to such a consent, against the modification or withdrawal of such a consent, or against the failure of the Council to determine an application for consent within the period prescribed by the 1981 Act; (b) section 28(L) of the 1981 Act, against a management notice served by the Council; (c) paragraph 11(1) of Schedule 11 to the 2000 Act, against a stop notice served by the Council in respect of operations on the land. These Regulations also prescribe the time within which an appeal under section 28(L)(1) of the 1981 Act must be brought.

Policy: Regional Act No. 12 laying down new provisions on the arrangement and functioning of the Regional Forest Corps and making provision on its personnel. Amendment to Regional Act No. 45 of 23 October 1995.
Policy_Content: This Regional Act has been enacted to regulate the functions, powers and duties of the Forest Corps of the Valle d’Aosta Region. This body is empowered to perform at regional level the functions and tasks which belong to the National Forest Corps. The functions are concerned with the protection and management of the agricultural and sylvo-pastoral territories, forests and mountain areas, soil, waters and natural resources as a whole. The Regional Forest Corps shall be particularly in charge of: (a) surveillance and protection of the forest heritage; (b) preservation of wildlife; (c) prevention of water and soil pollution; (d) supervision of the management of protected areas; (e) prevention of forest fires and performance of fire-fighting activities.

Policy: Environmental Affairs Law No. 50 of 2002.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of 8 Chapters divided into 37 articles. Chapter 1 provides for terms and definitions. Chapter 2 deals with the competencies and objectives of the General Authority for Environment Affairs in particular: (a) defining existing environmental problems and participating in the research and scientific studies to treat and solve them; (b) laying down the general policy and preparing the national strategy for the environment protection; (c) developing the public awareness for the protection and safety of the environment; (d) measuring standards and criteria of the environment; (e) preparing the environmental standardization and metrology standards as well as environmental impact assessment reports; (f) carrying out research and studies related to environmental affairs; (g) controlling the activities producing environmental impacts; (h) laying down environmental requirements and instructions necessary for agricultural, industrial, commercial, housing and development projects; (i) laying down the basis for the circulation of hazardous materials and for the creation of natural protected areas; (j) creating  environmental monitoring nets; (k) preparing environmental databanks and emergency plans; (m) issuing publications related to the environment; (n) preparing environmental legislation; (o) studying soil erosion causes, desertification as well as proposing solutions; (p) taking necessary measures to prevent the introduction of waste in Syria; (q) laying down instructions and rules for the classification of waste; and, (r) reinforcing the relationship between Syria and other States as well as with international and regional organizations in environmental affairs. Chapter 3 refers to the formation and management of the Authority. Chapter 4 defines competencies and duties of the Minister of State Affairs for Environment. Chapter 5 establishes the Environment Protection Council and defines its tasks. Chapter 6 provides for the creation of the Environment Protection and Support Fund. Chapter 7 deals with damage liability and compensation as well as with offences and penalties. Chapter 8 contains transitional provisions.

Policy: Regional Act No. 12 rearranging and redefining Mountain Communities.
Policy_Content: In implementation of Legislative Decree No. 267 of 18 August 2000 on the organization of local entities, the present Regional Act regulates the setting up of Mountain Communities and lays down rules and principles with respect to their functioning. Mountain Communities shall be constituted by joint mountain Communes with a view to ensuring the social and economic development of mountain zones, giving particular regard to less-favoured mountain areas (to be determined as per article 9). Mountain Communities shall be established by Decree of the President of the Regional Council by following the procedure described under articles 2 and 3 and by comprising the homogeneous zones listed out in the Annex to this Act. Title II deals with the organs of Mountain Communities. Each Mountain Community shall draw up and approve its own development plan (art. 29). Title V regards the allocation of financial resources intended for funding the activities and programmes covered by these provisions.

Policy: Law on state seismological expertise.
Policy_Content: The present Law determines legal and organizational basis for carrying out state seismological expertise and is aimed at the prevention of negative impact of the possible manifestations of dangerous natural geological and combined natural and man-made processes human life and health, and also upon environment.  State seismological expertise is compulsory form of assessment of the compliance of architectural, urban land use planning and construction activity with the requirements of state standards of seismic safety (art. 1).  The purpose of state seismological expertise is the reduction of the possible impact of the manifestations of dangerous natural, geological and combined natural and man-made processes (art. 3).  State seismological expertise shall be carried out by the authorized institution that shall ensure carrying out state seismological expertise, monitoring, research, zoning and valuation of unsafe areas form the seismic point of view (art. 6).  The Law consists of 7 Sections composed of 28 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation concerning detailed requirements for air protection programmes.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of eight Paragraphs, establishes detailed requirements for air protection programmes, prepared in paper or electronic form. The air protection programmes shall consist of the following parts: description; specification of duties and restrictions resulting from implementation of the programme; justification of the scope of specified and evaluated issues. The description includes: description of the area specified in the programme; description of air quality standards violation; basic directions and scope of activities required to restore air quality standards; list of substances included in the programme and source of their origin; schedule of the programme implementation, including implementation of individual tasks; costs of the programme implementation, including implementation of individual tasks; sources of the programme financing; and types of information and documents required for controlling the programme implementation.

Policy: Plan Forestal Español.
Policy_Content: El Plan Forestal Español es un instrumento estratégico de alcance nacional cuyo objeto es estructurar las acciones necesarias para el desarrollo de una política forestal española basada en los siguientes principios: a) desarrollo sostenible (mediante la ordenación de los montes y el impulso de la selvicultura, según directrices que recojan los criterios e indicadores paneuropeos para la gestión sostenible de los ecosistemas forestales); b) multifuncionalidad de los montes; c) contribución a la cohesión territorial a través del desarrollo rural, fijando población y empleo, mejorando el entorno socioeconómico del ámbito rural; d) contribución a la cohesión ecológica, integrando la conservación de la diversidad biológica en la gestión forestal y preservando, además, el patrimonio genético forestal y la diversidad paisajística; e) participación pública y social en la formulación de las políticas, estrategias y programas, proponiendo la corresponsabilidad de la sociedad en la conservación y gestión de los montes. Uno de los objetivos específicos del Plan es promover la protección del territorio en general, y de los montes en particular, de la acción de los procesos erosivos y de degradación del suelo mediante la restauración de la cubierta vegetal protectora y sus acciones complementarias, ampliando la superficie arbolada con fines de protección, y al mismo tiempo, incrementando la fijación de carbono en la biomasa forestal para contribuir a paliar las causas del cambio climático.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Land & soil

Policy: Environmental Protection (Restriction on Use of Lead Shot) (Wales) Regulations 2002 (S.I. No. 1730 (W. 164) of 2002).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, which apply to Wales, prohibit the use of lead shot for shooting with a shotgun: (a) on or over any area below the high-water mark; (b) on or over the sites of special scientific interest included in Schedule 1 to the Regulations; or (c) any wild bird included in Schedule 2 to the Regulations namely ducks and geese (all species of each), coot and moorhen (regulation 3). "Lead shot" means any shot made of lead or of any alloy or compound of lead where lead comprises more than 1 percent of that alloy or compound (reg. 2). Regulation 4 provides for powers of entry and inspection, a power to take samples, and a power to take any dead or injured wild birds, in order to determine whether any provisions of the Regulations have been broken. Regulation 5 provides that breach of regulation 3, or obstruction of a person exercising any power under regulation 4, is a criminal offence.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon relatif à la procédure et à diverses mesures d'exécution du décret du 11 mars 1999 relatif au permis d'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement wallon est relatif à la procédure et à diverses mesures d'exécution du décret du 11 mars 1999 relatif au permis d'environnement. L’article 2 établit que la demande de permis d'environnement relative aux établissements non visés à l'alinéa 2 est introduite au moyen d'un formulaire dont le modèle figure en annexe I du présent arrêté. En outre, la demande de permis d'environnement relative à une installation ou une activité visée aux rubriques 01.20 à 01.40 de l'annexe I de l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 4 juillet 2002 arrêtant la liste des projets soumis à étude d'incidences et des installations et activités classées est introduite au moyen d'un formulaire dont le modèle figure en annexe II du présent arrêté. Si la demande de permis d'environnement est relative à une prise d'eau, elle comprend, outre les renseignements demandés dans le formulaire visé à l'alinéa 1er du présent article, les informations reprises à l'annexe III du présent arrêté. Si la demande de permis d'environnement est relative à une demande de déversement d'eaux usées des stations d'épuration publiques, elle comprend, outre les renseignements demandés dans le formulaire visé à l'alinéa 1er du présent article, les informations reprises à l'annexe IV du présent arrêté. Si la demande de permis d'environnement est relative à une installation ou une activité de regroupement, d'élimination ou de valorisation des déchets, elle comprend, outre les renseignements demandés dans le formulaire visé à l'alinéa 1er du présent article, les informations reprises à l'annexe V du présent arrêté. Le texte comprend 280 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Définitions (Ier); Procédures (II); Remise en état (III); Dispositions abrogatoires, modificatives et finales (IV). Seize annexes sont jointes

Policy: Complementary Law No. 6.462 establishing the State Policy on Forests and other Forms of Vegetation.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 39 articles divided into two Chapters, establishes the State Policy on Forests and other Forms of Vegetation. The Policy is a set of principles, objectives and instruments of action for the purpose of preserving, conserving and recovering the natural flora heritage and contributing to the socio-economic development of the State of Pará, in accordance with the State Environmental Policy and the Federal Legislation. The forests and other forms of vegetation make up the heritage of natural flora of the State, recognizing its ecological, cultural and economic value. The objectives of the State Policy aim to perform the following activities: ensure the availability of the natural resources of the flora to the present and future generations, in accordance with their needs and the adequate quality standards to their respective uses; identify, create, deploy and manage conservation units to protect representative samples of plant ecosystems; promote and support the development of research and dissemination of technologies aimed at the utilization of products of the natural flora and for the valorization of new forest species; measure the ecological, economic and social value of the natural flora of the State; carry out monitoring of the natural flora of the State; contribute to the implementation of ecological-economic zoning; create means and instruments to supply the demand for bioenergy, wood and non-wood products; institute programmes for the recovery of degraded areas; institute and disseminate programmes for environmental education and eco-tourism; promote the conservation and preservation of natural flora resources and its genetic heritage; guide, prevent and control pests, diseases and forest fires; identify and monitor plant associations, endangered and endemic species; etc.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Law No. 332-II ZRK on geodesy and cartography.
Policy_Content: The present Law regulates relations between state institutions, natural and legal persons in the sphere of geodetic and cartographic activity. The Law consists of 18 articles. Article 1 introduces the main concepts. Article 2 specifies legislation in the sphere of geodesy and cartography. Article 3 classifies objects and subjects of geodetic and cartographic activity. Article 4 specifies the main directions of geodetic and cartographic activity. Article 5 establishes the competence of the government. Article 6 establishes the competence of the authorized institution. Article 7 regards state licensing of geodetic and cartographic activity. Article 8 establishes technical requirements. Article 9 regards metrological backing. Article 10 deals with financing. Article 11 regards copyright of geodetic and cartographic production. Article 12 regards national cartographic and geodetic fund. Article 13 regards state property of cartographic and geodetic production. Article 14 deals with cartographic and geodetic activity for defence and national security purposes. Article 15 regards access to information. Article 16 regards protection of state geodetic network stations. Article 17 regards international cooperation. Article 18 establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation on geodetic and cartographic activity.
