Policy: Law No.IX-884 of 2002 on energy.
Policy_Content: The Law on Energy regulates general energy activities, the basic principles of energy development and management, energy and energy resources efficiency. Peculiarities of activities of individual energy systems and of relations between energy enterprises and consumers shall be established by other laws. Provisions of other laws regulating energy activities shall be applicable to the extent they are not contrary to this Law. The principal objectives of regulation of state energy sector activities shall be as follows: 1) security of energy supplies; 2) energy resources and energy efficiency; 3) reduction of adverse effects of energy activities on the environment; 4) promotion of fair competition; 5) promotion of consumption of indigenous and renewable energy resources. State management of the energy sector shall be carried out according to the procedure established by this Law by: 1) the Government or its authorised institution; 2) the Ministry of Economy; 3) the Ministry of the Environment; 4) municipalities. The main tasks of the State and municipal institutions, managing the energy sector, regulating and controlling the energy sector activities shall be as follows:1) ensuring optimum structure of the state energy sector; 2) creating preconditions for efficient energy sector activities; 3) ensuring uninterrupted energy supply and stability of the established quality parameters; 4) promoting energy and energy resources efficiency; 5) promoting consumption of indigenous and renewable energy resources; 6) encouraging enterprises to carry out energy audits. The document consists of VII Chapters that contain 30 Articles. Chapter I (arts. 1-2) lays down general provisions. Chapter II (Arts.3-8) regards energy sector activity and management. Chapter III (Arts.9-14) deals with development of the energy sector. Chapter IV (Arts.15-24) regards regulation of the energy sector. Chapter V (art. 25) deals with emergency in the energy sector. Chapter VI (Arts.26-27) regards hearing of complaints and liability. Chapter VII (Arts.28-30) lays down final provisions.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Basic legislation,Renewable energy,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Nuclear energy

Policy: Decree No. 3 of the State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy and Cartography validating the Regulation on mapping of the boundaries of land plots.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of demarcation, restoration and determination of the boundaries of land plots and legalization thereof. It shall be compulsory for land tenants, landowners, lessees and organizations and individual entrepreneurs carrying out land survey practices. The establishment of lands plot boundaries shall be compulsory preliminary condition for land allotment. The scope of mapping of land boundaries shall be to ensure: (a) indisputable delimitation of the boundaries of land plots; (b) accurate land registration; (c) indisputable restoration of the boundaries of land plots in case of loss (destruction) of landmarks and boundary lines; (d) state control over purposeful and rational land tenure; (e) reliability of payment of the land charges; and (f) correct legal and technical registration of land boundaries.

Policy: Décret nº 2002-895 relatif aux attributions du Ministre de l'écologie et du développement durable.
Policy_Content: Le ministre de l'écologie et du développement durable veille à l'intégration des objectifs de développement durable dans l'élaboration et la mise en oeuvre des politiques publiques, notamment en ce qui concerne la gestion des espaces et des ressources naturels et l'aménagement du territoire. Il prépare et met en oeuvre les politiques publiques en matière d'écologie. Il coordonne notamment les actions menées dans le domaine de l'environnement. Il peut présider, par délégation du Premier ministre, le comité interministériel de l'environnement. Au titre de la politique de l'environnement, il exerce notamment les attributions suivantes: 1) Il est responsable des actions de protection de la nature, des paysages et des sites; 2) Il veille à la protection de la biodiversité; 3) Il veille à la protection du littoral et de la montagne; 4) Il assure la police et la gestion de la chasse et de la pêche en eau douce; 5) Il assure, en liaison avec les ministres intéressés, la police de l'exploitation des carrières et des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement; 6) Il assure la protection, la police et la gestion des eaux, à l'exception de la gestion du domaine public fluvial affecté à la navigation et de la police y afférente; 7) Il définit et met en oeuvre les actions relatives à la préservation de la qualité de l'air et à la lutte contre l'effet de serre et les changements climatiques; 8) Il veille, en liaison avec les ministres intéressés, à la réduction des nuisances sonores; 9) Il assure la coordination des actions concernant la prévention des risques majeurs d'origine technologique ou naturelle; 10) Il élabore et met en oeuvre, conjointement avec le ministre chargé de l'industrie, la politique en matière de sûreté nucléaire, y compris en ce qui concerne le transport des matières radioactives et fissiles à usage civil; 11) Il est associé à la détermination et à la mise en oeuvre de la politique d'utilisation rationnelle des ressources énergétiques et de développement des énergies renouvelables; 12) Il participe à la détermination et à la mise en oeuvre de la politique en matière d'urbanisme, d'équipement, de transports et de grandes infrastructures, en particulier en ce qui concerne la prévention et la réduction des risques écologiques; 13) Il participe à la détermination de la politique d'aménagement de l'espace rural et de la forêt; 14) Il participe à la détermination de la politique de la santé en tant que cette dernière est liée à l'environnement; 15) Il est responsable, en liaison avec les ministres intéressés, de la politique de réduction et de traitement des déchets; 16) Il propose toute mesure destinée à développer les industries et services de l'environnement; 17) Il participe à la détermination de la politique de recherche et d'innovation en matière d'environnement
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No. 22-rz “On industrial activity”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects and organizations in the industrial sphere, regional state bodies and local government. Industrial policy shall be considered coordinated number of arrangements by regional state bodies aimed at legislative, economic, information, organizational and administrative regulation in the sphere of industrial policy. Industrial activity shall be considered production activity in the sphere of industry, including energy generation and production. Regional Government shall be responsible for conduct of innovative industrial policy, including research, ensuring public financial support and subsidies in the industrial sphere, in particular to engineering activity with specific purpose of improvement of environmental security of industrial processes, prevention of technological disasters originating from industrial activity, also through utilization of best available ecofriendly processes and technologies.

Policy: Law No. 1426-bc on the grounds of issuing licences and permits for entrepreneurial activity.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 5 Sections. The present Law regulates relations connected with issuing licences and permits for entrepreneurial activity, determines comprehensive list of the types of activity subject to licensing and authorization, authorized administrative bodies and establishes the modalities of issuing licences and permits, amendments to them, their suspension, cancellation and revocation. Types of activity subject to licensing include: 1) processing of foodstuffs (including infant food), processing of tobaccos – licensing authority for these activities is the Ministry of Agriculture and Food; 2) manufacturing, repairs and trade of firearms and ammunition – licensing authority for these activities is the Ministry of Justice; 3) nuclear and radiation activity – licensing authority is the Ministry for Environmental Protection and Natural Resources; 4) production and distribution of electric energy - licensing authority is the National Commission for Regulation of Energy; 5) veterinary activity, manufacturing of veterinary drugs, pesticides and agro-chemicals and their trade – licensing authority is the Ministry of Agriculture and Food ; utilization, transformation, processing and transportation of oil and gas – licensing authority is the State Agency for Regulation of Oil and Gas Resources ; 6) use of natural resources (except for oil, gas, land and forests), environmental impact assessment – licensing authority is the Ministry for Environmental Protection and Natural Resources; 7) mining activity – licensing activity is the State Geological Department.

Policy: Re-enactment of the Urban Lease Holding Proclamation (No. 272/2002).
Policy_Content: A Proclamation to provide for the utilization of urban land. Urban land is defined as all land within urban boundaries (art. 2). The Proclamation shall apply to urban land held by a permit system, or by lease-hold system, as well as by other means in force prior to those systems (art. 3). Urban land may be held in long-term lease by permit in accordance with plan guidelines, on auction or through negotiation on the basis of a decision of the Region or city concerned (art. 4). A leasehold deed shall be conferred upon a person who is permitted to hold land on lease. Article 6 prescribes the duration of leases in various areas and for various uses. The rates of rent shall be determined by a law issued by the appropriate regional or city government (art. 8). A person to whom lease-hold of urban land is permitted shall begin use of the land in accordance with the permit within a period prescribed in Regulations issued by the regional or city government (art. 12). Article 15 provides for the termination of lease agreements. (25 sections)

Policy: Framework Act on Marine Fishery Development.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to the development of national economy and the improvement of national welfare, by determining the Government's basic policy and its directions for the rational management, preservation, development and utilization of the sea and marine resources, and the fostering of marine industries. The Government shall establish mid-and-long-term policy objectives and directions thereof concerning marine fishery development and formulate and implement every 10 years the basic policies for marine fishery development. The Marine Fishery Development Committee shall be established under the control of the Prime Minister in order to deliberate on the basic plan and the important policies on the marine development, etc. In order to preserve and manage the marine environment the Government shall adopt policies necessary for developing marine safety technologies, improving marine traffic environment and securing the safety of the ships. In order to explore, develop, manage and preserve marine living resources the Government shall conduct scientific investigation and observation on the sea, improve fishing and processing technology, promote the efficient international cooperation, such as the establishment of the organization for technological cooperation, information exchange, joint survey and research concerning the marine development, etc. The Government shall devise and implement policies required for the fosterage of maritime traffic industry and the development of harbour industry, for the expansion of harbour facilities and fishing port facilities and for the fosterage of fisheries that are compatible with ecological conditions and environment-friendly. The Government may establish and foster research institutes and training and educational institutes.

Articles 7 to 9 regard waste water and water discharges. Article 12 concerns dams. Further, the penalties to be applied in case of violation of the present provisions are laid down in article 13. Part V of the Decree, on the other hand, regards the application of Legislative Decree No. 372 of 1999 concerning the integrated environmental authorization, to be issued by the Provincial Agency for the Protection of the Environment.

Policy: Law No. 29 on energy saving.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the relations in the sphere of energy saving with a view of more efficient use of energy resources. It establishes that energy saving shall be a priority of the state policy in the sphere of energy. The Act consists of seven Chapters divided into 24 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) state regulation; (3) standardization, certification and metrology; (4) economic and financial mechanisms of energy saving; (5) international cooperation; (6) vocational training and access to information; and (7) liability. The sphere of application of this Law shall be: (a) energy production, conservation and transportation; (b) renewable energy; (c) scientific research; (d) state supervision over the rational and efficient utilization of energy resources; and (e) access to information on energy sources, use of renewable energy and new fuels. The state management of energy saving shall be carried out by the authorized state institutions. Energy consuming devices and energy resources shall be subject to compulsory certification for compliance with energetic efficiency.

Policy: Law No. 48 on Dehkan farm.
Policy_Content: The present Law defines the legal basis for organization and activity of Dehkan farms in the Republic of Tajikistan. The Dehkan farm is an independent managing subject carrying out its activities being not a legal person and based on individual business of a person, or members of the one family and other citizens jointly producing agricultural commodities on the basis of the plot of land and other properties being in its possession. The document consists of 34 Articles. Article 1 establishes the purpose of the present Law. Article 2 regards legislation on Dehkan farm. Article 3 defines the concept of Dehkan farm. Article 4 concerns members of Dehkan farm. Article 5 regards Dehkan farms as an agricultural enterprise. Article 6 establishes the rights and form for classification an agricultural enterprise as Dehkan farm. Article 7 concerns the head of Dehkan farm. Article 8 regards the right of Dehkan farm to institute community management. Article 9 deals with coordination of activity of Dehkan farm. Article 10 determines the conditions for concession of land. Article 11 determines size of the plots of land conceded for setting up Dehkan farm. Article 12 establishes the modalities of the formation of the stock of land for the creation of Dehkan farm. Article 13 regards the right to land tenure by Dehkan farm. Article 14 establishes the modalities of concession of plots of land for setting up Dehkan farm. Article 15 regards the modalities of setting up Dehkan farm on the land belonging to state enterprises and other forms of ownership. Article 16 concerns state registration. Article 17 determines the rights of Dehkan farm and its members. Article 18 determines the duties of Dehkan farm and its members. Article 19 regards inheritance Dehkan farm and its property. Article 20 regards financial activity. Article 21 regards crediting. Article 22 regards working conditions in Dehkan farm. Article 23 regards accounting and reporting. Article 24 regards Dehkan farms’ associations. Article 25 regards welfare. Article 26 deals with state support. Article 27 concerns taxation. Article 28 regards formation of Dehkan farms’ associations. Article 29 regards management of Dehkan farms’ associations. Article 30 regards production process, financial and economic activity of Dehkan farm. Article 31 establishes grounds for liquidation of Dehkan farm. Article 32 determines the modalities of liquidation. Article 33 regards dispute settlement. Article 34 establishes liability for the infringement of the present Law.

Policy: Order No. 177 of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the procedure and criteria for state registration of objects that cause or may have a harmful effect on human health and the state of the air, types and volumes of pollutants emitted into the atmosphere.
Policy_Content: This Order sets criteria for state registration depending on the types and volumes of pollutants emitted into the air, and establishes mandatory requirements for a unified procedure for submitting materials for state registration of enterprises, establishments, organizations and natural persons-entrepreneurs that perform emission of pollutant into the atmospheric air from stationary sources. Data on the types and amount of pollutants emitted into the atmosphere are compiled on the basis of inventory composition of emitted pollutants. State registration shall be performed according to the following criteria: (a) objects - if in their emissions there is at least one pollutant (or a group of substances), a potential emission of which is equal to or exceeds indices specified in the List of pollutants and the thresholds of potential emissions, which are subject to state registration (Annex 1); and (b) types and amount of pollutants emitted into the atmosphere - provided that the volume of potential emissions is equal to or exceeds the thresholds for a single substance or group of substances specified in Annex 1 to this Regulation.

Policy: Plant Health (Phytophthora ramorum) (Scotland) Order 2002 (S.S.I. No. 223 of 2002).
Policy_Content: This Order implements measures to prevent the introduction and spread of the pest Phytophthora ramorum, a fungus which is not established in Scotland. It regulates the importation and movement into and within Scotland of plant material identified as susceptible to the pest, believed to cause Sudden Oak Death syndrome in certain species of oak in the USA, and harm to Rhododendron, Viburnum and other plants. This Order restricts the importation of a number of plant genera, including Rhododendron and Viburnum directly from the USA by requiring that such imports be accompanied by a phytosanitary certificate which confirms that the material originates from a location which is officially recognised in the USA as free from the pest.

Policy: Loi nº 02-08 relative aux conditions de création des villes nouvelles et de leur aménagement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe les conditions de création des villes nouvelles et de leur aménagement. Sont considérées comme villes nouvelles toutes créations d'établissements humains à caractère urbain en sites vierges, ou s'appuyant sur un ou plusieurs noyaux d'habitat existants. Le schéma national d'aménagement du territoire prévoit l'opportunité de création de ville nouvelle et en détermine les fonctions et la localisation. Toute ville nouvelle est créée en relation avec l'organisation et le développement des grandes infrastructures et services publics d'intérêt national, arrêtés par les schémas sectoriels issus du schéma national d'aménagement du territoire. La création de villes nouvelles ne peut intervenir que dans les régions des Hauts-Plateaux et du Sud. Pour la réalisation des villes nouvelles l'Etat prévoit toutes mesures d'incitation, de soutien et d'aide nécessaires.

Policy: Act on EU Agricultural Subsidy Policy (No. 297 of 2004).
Policy_Content: The Act defines measures necessary for the implementation of EU regulations in regards to the  organization and administration of agricultural markets. Among these: production of agricultural products, information on agricultural income and business operations; and application of special conversion rates for the Common Agricultural Policy. The Ministry sets up a committee to advise and evaluate EU agricultural policy with respect to the organization of its administration. The Committee consists of 24 members appointed for the duration of 4 years by the Ministry who mat order importers, exporters, manufacturers, traders and industry organizations to provide the information necessary to meet EU rules on Member States' reporting on agriculture. In base of these, the Minister may regulate payment of taxes on agricultural products and to pay fees for similar agricultural commodities imported in Denmark. The Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Fisheries receives from the Treasury 83% of funds paid to the Treasury in adherence to the Act on taxes on pesticides, and may determine the allocation of resources between the Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Fisheries, the percentage tax fund for the growing of fruit and horticulture, and percentage tax fund for agriculture (Chapter 2, section 2).

Policy: Resolution No. 7 of 2002 on the control of the importation and use of prohibited and severely restricted chemical substances.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to protect public health and the environment. The present Resolution is composed of 17 articles and 2 Tables. Article 1 deals with terms and definitions. Policy: Law No. 1392 on the promotion of leasing.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this law is to develop relations originated by lease contracts as envisaged in the civil code and to promote leasing. It envisages the following types of leases: (a) direct leasing, during which the lessor is the owner or producer of the leased property; (b) compensational leasing, in which the lessee makes lease payments in the form of in-kind contributions (goods, services, labor); (c) service leasing, where services are provided by the lessor in the form of management, insurance, warranty services, repair activities, etc.; and (d) pure leasing, one in which the lessor is not obligated to provide services in relation to the leased property. The lessor shall have the right to register the lease contract in the relevant public registry. Non-registry of a lease contract shall not affect its validity or enforceability. A lease is a separate right and, despite being attached to immovable or movable property, the lessor retains ownership over leased property until the lessee becomes an owner of the leased property under the contract.

Policy: Law No. AL-337 on local self-government.
Policy_Content: This Law is to set out the role of local self-government and to regulate relations between the State authorities and local self-government bodies. Local self-government bodies shall be responsible for the management of community’s property and financial resources. A community is a legal entity and disposes its property independently. This Act shall be applicable to city and rural communities. The competence of local self-government shall include: (a) land zoning and land use planning; (b) urban development and maintenance of the objects of cultural heritage. Lands located within administrative boundaries of a community shall be transferred free of charge under the jurisdiction of the respective community.

Policy_Content: This Regulation shall provide guidelines for an efficient energy market and an adequate supply in the power system. It ensures that the system responsibility is exercised in a socially efficient manner, including taking account of public and private interests affected, and applies to the administrator and network operators, production or organized markets, as well as end users. Regional licensing in regional and national grid shall prepare an overview of installations of maximum transfer limits. The summary shall be presented to the system responsible entity for decision. Licensed entities shall notify about plans for new construction or modification of own facilities connected to the regional and national grid,and when this would affect other licensees. Licensed energy providers shall prepare long-term plans for the effective implementation of outages in their plants in the regional and the national grid, and associated production facilities. Policy: Regional Law No. 703-OD “On institution of natural park “Nishnekhopiorskiy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for management and conservation of natural ecosystems, including natural waterbodies and landscapes. The scope of institution of natural park “Nishnekhopiorskiy” shall be to use it for environmental, educational, scientific and research purposes. Natural park shall carry out the following functions: (a) conservation of natural environment, unique natural landscapes and complexes; (b) protection and conservation of rare and endangered plant and animal species recorded in the Red Book of the Russian Federation; (c) conservation of the objects of historical and cultural heritage; (d) recreational use of natural resources and organization of recreational tourism; and (e) restoration of damaged natural, historical and cultural complexes and objects. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of natural park: (a) any type of construction; (b) stock enhancement and repopulation of waterbodies; (c) grazing of small cattle; (d) unauthorized haymaking; and (e) movement of means of transport and persons outside established itineraries and without accompanying staff.

Policy: The Austrian Strategy for Sustainable Development
Policy_Content: The Austrian Strategy for Sustainable Development contains 20 key objectives, which are broken down into four major fields of action. The four fields of action are 1) Quality of life in Austria, a task for today and tomorrows, 2) Austria as a dynamic business location, success through innovation and networking, 3) Austria as a living space, protection of biodiversity and quality, and 4) Austria’s responsibility as an active role in Europe and the world. The strategy was drafted as a guidance document for bottom-up action and a document of self-obligation for the government of Austria. Sound public finance is hereby mentioned as a basis for sustainable development, which includes a sound national budget, no new debt, and a lower tax burden for the population. For each key objective, a problem statement/background, objective and starting points are given. After the substantive sections on the actions and objectives, the implementation is specified. The process should ensure that the strategy is implemented, targets are achieved within the defined period, the process and instruments of implementation are defied, responsibilities are clear, participation, self-organisation and commitment are promoted, the public is sensitized and kept informed, mechanisms for coordination with existing strategies are established, strategic networks with the regional and local level are set up, the status of implementation is assessed by continuous monitoring, and further development of the strategy is made possible through regular evaluation and reflection. Within the various fields of action, the further expansion of forestry policy instruments based on broad interdisciplinary, intersector collaboration and the development of a national forestry programme for Austria are envisioned to achieve sustainable forestry. With regard to agriculture and forestry, possibilities for the production of renewable raw materials are discussed. In the field of action “Austria as a living space”, the promotion of rural development is discussed; the remuneration of environmental services, strengthening agricultural businesses and general social impacts in particular. The policy addresses agriculture at great length and identifies the forestry sector as having potential for new job creation and reducing rural poverty. Agriculture is identified as an important function in guaranteeing health. Areas within the EU sustainability strategy mentioned are inter alia the healthiness of food, food safety and quality, animal protection, and the protection of nature and landscape. The strategy includes a 70-page annex, which includes first steps and innovative examples. The guiding principle followed is the creation and maintenance of a country that guarantees an intact environment, economic performance and social cohesion in the long term, without violating intergenerational justice or evading global responsibility.

Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of organization and carrying out supervision over land use planning. Policy: Ministerial Decree No.570 regarding validation of the Regulation on State Hydrometeorological Service.
Policy_Content: State Hydrometeorological Service is governmental body of public administration under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Natural Resources. State Hydrometeorological Service, within the sphere of its competence, organizes and carries out systematic control over the observance of the legislation regarding issue pertaining to its competence, elaborates the proposals for the improvement of the legislation and forwards it for the examination by the Ministry of Natural Resources. The main tasks of State Hydrometeorological Service are: 1) participation in the realization of state policy in the sphere of hydrometeorology and environmental monitoring; 2) assistance to management and control in the sphere of hydrometeorological activity; 3) organization of hydrometeorological and climatic study of the territory of Ukraine; 4) realization, within its sphere of competence, of scientific and technical policy; 5) cooperation with international organizations and national hydrometeorological services of foreign states.

Policy: Arrêté du 25 avril 2002 relatif au report de la date de broyage de la jachère de tous terrains à usage agricole.
Policy_Content: En application du troisième alinéa de l'article L. 424-1 du Code de l'environnement, il ne peut être procédé ni au broyage ni au fauchage de la jachère de tous terrains à usage agricole entre le 1er avril et le 31 juillet. Dans le cas de prolifération anormale d'adventices, le préfet peut, sur demande individuelle motivée, autoriser le recours au broyage ou au fauchage pendant cette période.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Law No. 1007-XV on production cooperatives.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates inter alia the activity of agricultural cooperatives. Agricultural production cooperative shall be recognized as such if no less than 50 percent of its annual production output is constituted by agricultural commodities. It establishes that a member of agricultural cooperative can make contribution to the authorized capital stock in the form of a plot of agricultural land with transfer of the ownership certificate. Agricultural cooperative shall be authorized to use agricultural land plots of its members in accordance with lease contract.Any amendments and modifications to the statute of the cooperative shall be deemed effective with the provisions the day of their state registration in the manner prescribed by law. When entering into the charter capital of a real estate cooperative transferred against the value shares of property of agricultural enterprises, changes in the statute of the cooperative are not mandatory. A cooperative may conduct its activities only after state registration in accordance with the law. It is prohibited to establish any preferential rights for cooperative members. Agricultural land with the transfer of the property document cannot be pledged as a share deposit. Any member of the cooperative can only own one share.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Décret nº 2002-631 du 25 avril 2002 relatif à la qualification des exploitations agricoles au titre de l'agriculture raisonnée.
Policy_Content: Les modes de production raisonnés en agriculture consistent en la mise en oeuvre, par l'exploitant agricole sur l'ensemble de son exploitation dans une approche globale de celle-ci, de moyens techniques et de pratiques agricoles conformes aux exigences du référentiel de l'agriculture raisonnée. Le référentiel porte sur le respect de l'environnement, la maîtrise des risques sanitaires, la santé et la sécurité au travail et le bien-être des animaux. Ce référentiel comprend des exigences nationales applicables à l'ensemble du territoire et des exigences territoriales propres à des zones géographiques définies en fonction de leurs enjeux environnementaux. Les ministres chargés de l'agriculture et de la consommation arrêtent par décision conjointe le référentiel de l'agriculture raisonnée, qui est publié au Journal officiel de la République française. Les dispositions du présent décret réglementent la procédure de qualification, qui permet d'attester qu'une exploitation agricole satisfait aux exigences contenues dans le référentiel de l'agriculture raisonnée. Il est créée une commission nationale de l'agriculture raisonnée et de la qualification des exploitations. Elle comprend deux sections, l'une chargée de l'examen du référentiel, l'autre de l'agrément des organismes certificateurs, et une commission permanente.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Law No. 81-ZO “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates organization, protection and management of protected areas of regional or local significance with a view of conservation, reproduction and restoration of unique and typical natural ecosystems and objects, wild fauna and wild flora species and genetic resources thereof, study of the natural processes in the biosphere and supervision over change of state thereof, and ecological education of the population. Constitution, protection and management of protected areas shall be based upon the following principles: (a) priority of national and regional interests in dealing with issues related to protected areas; (b) prevalence of conservation of protected areas over management thereof; (c) prevalence of use of protected areas for scientific research, cultural, educational and recreational purposes; (d) prohibition of economic activities not compatible with protection and conservation of protected areas; (e) mandatory environmental audit; and (f) sustainability.

Policy: Stock Route Management Act 2002.
Policy_Content: The purposes of the Act are to provide for pest management for land and for stock route network management, it consists of 333 sections and is divided into 11 Chapters. Chapter 1 concerns the purpose and application of the Act and clarifies the relationship of the Act with the Nature Conservation Act 1992, the Forestry Act 1959 and the Dividing Fences Act 1953. Chapter 2 is dedicated to pest management, it contains provisions on the principles for pest management (Part 1), on the state management strategies and guidelines for managing pests (Part 2), on pest management plans for local government areas (Part 4), on pest control for land (Part 8) and on emergency control of declared pests (Part 9). The Chapter also calls for the establishment of a pest management committee for State-controlled areas and provides for its organization and functions (Part 3) and regulates declared pest fences (Part 6) and declared pest permits (Part 7).

Policy: Regional Act No. 11 on the protection of autochthonous genetic resources of agricultural and forestry interest.
Policy_Content: The Friuli Venezia Giulia Region encourages the protection of autochthonous genetic resources of agricultural and forestry interest, including spontaneous plants related to cultivated species. The definition of autochthonous species, on the other hand, includes as well external species and varieties which entered into the regional territory at least fifty years ago. The Act consists of 8 articles. Article 2 regards the voluntary Regional Registry, which is established with a view to protecting autochthonous genetic resources. The registry is divided into two specific sections: the animal section and the vegetable section. Paragraph 3 of article 2 makes provision in matter of registration. Article 3 provides for the establishment of the Technical and Scientific Commission for the Animal Sector, on the one hand, and the Technical and Scientific Commission for the Vegetable Sector, on the other hand. In order to guarantee the effective protection and conservation of genetic resources registered in the above-mentioned registry, article 4 sets up the Conservation and Safety Net, which shall be managed and coordinated by the Regional Entity for the Promotion and Development of Agriculture (ERSA). Article 6 deals with forestry biodiversity protection. Article 7 concerns intervention programmes to be drawn up by the Region, which must encourage public and private initiatives intended for biodiversity conservation, promote the propagation of genetic resources. The intervention programmes shall be implemented by the ERSA and shall be suject to checks carried out by the Regional Management for Agriculture.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement de la Région de Bruxelles-Capitale concernant la mise en décharge des déchets.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté transpose la directive 1999/31/CE du Conseil du 26 avril 1999 concernant la mise en décharge des déchets. Il a pour objet de prévoir des mesures, procédures et orientations visant à prévenir ou à réduire autant que possible les effets négatifs de la mise en décharge des déchets sur l'environnement, et notamment la pollution des eaux de surface, des eaux souterraines, du sol et de l'air, et sur l'environnement de la planète, y compris l'effet de serre, ainsi que les risques qui en résultent pour la santé humaine, pendant toute la durée de vie de la décharge. Le texte comprend 16 articles traitant les aspects suivants: Définitions; Catégories de décharges; Déchets et traitements non admis dans les décharges; Déchets admis dans les différentes catégories de décharges; Demande de permis d'environnement; Conditions d'exploitation; Contenu du permis d'environnement; Coût de la mise en décharge des déchets; Procédure d'admission des déchets; Procédure de désaffectation et de gestion après désaffectation ; Décharges existantes; Décharges anciennes. Trois annexes sont jointes à cet arrêté.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Law on Corruption Prevention and Combating Bureau (2002)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to prescribe the legal status and functioning of the Corruption Prevention and Combating Bureau in order to pursue corruption prevention and combating with a complex approach, as well as to control fulfilment of the financing provisions of political organisations (parties) and associations thereof. The Bureau is the institution of direct administration which performs the functions laid down in this Law for corruption prevention and combating, and also controls fulfilment of financing regulations of political organisations (parties) and associations thereof and inspects how the restrictions laid down for the pre-election campaign, the campaign before referendum, the campaign for the initiation of a law, and the campaign for the initiation of recalling of the Saeima are complied with. The Bureau is under supervision of the Cabinet. The Cabinet shall implement the institutional supervision with the intermediation of the Prime Minister. Supervision shall include the right of the Prime Minister to inspect the rule of law of administrative decisions taken by the Head of the Bureau and withdraw unlawful decisions, and also, upon detecting unlawful failure to act, issue an order to take a decision.

Policy: Regional Act No. 19 making provision on land protection, management and use.
Policy_Content: The present Regional Act makes provision in matter of land use planning and land protection. It regulates the exercise of the relevant administrative functions by the competent authorities. The Calabria Region prompts cooperation among the Region itself, the Provinces, the Communes and Mountain Communities. The overall aims hereby pursued are sustainable development and the appropriate use of natural resources. Article 3 lays down general principles to be applied for the purposes of urban land planning. Article 8 provides for the setting up of the Territorial Information System and the Observatory of Territorial Transformation. The Region, the Provinces and the Communes shall carry out sustainability and environmental impact assessments prior to the approval of their respective plans (art. 10). Title II of the Act aims at enhancing participation of local community in the procedures which lead to the elaboration and approval of land use plans. Title IV describes fully the planning instruments and their content. Most importantly, article 17 regards the Regional Territorial Framework. Further, Title V regulates the procedures to be followed for approving the above-mentioned instruments. Title VII is entirely devoted to agroforestry land planning. The objectives to be attained are listed out in article 50, which includes among others soil protection and the rational utilization of natural resources. The Communes shall define the different agricultural areas as prescribed by article 50.

Policy: Decree No. 157 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on criteria and principles for determination of equivalence of different types of radioactive waste.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes criteria and principles for determination of equivalence of different types of radioactive waste. It shall be applicable to foreign state if, in case of recycling of radioactive waste imported form Latvia, it is impossible to determine class of radioactive waste and subsequently equivalent quantity of other radioactive waste is exported to Latvia. Basic principles of determination of equivalence shall include protection of the population and environment against ionizing radiation and lack of danger for the present and the future generations. Equivalence shall be established exclusively for radioactive waste containing radionuclides with half-disintegration period over 100 days or for radionuclides causing after disintegration the formation of radionuclides with half-disintegration period over 100 days. Criteria for determination of equivalence shall include risk or possibility of causing nuclear disaster and hazardous consequences thereof.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 240 regarding measures for the prevention of oil pollution.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the requirements for oil pollution prevention measures in order to reduce its negative impact on the environment. Such measures shall be undertaken by the federal and regional executive bodies, local self-government bodies and organizations that carry out exploration of oil deposits and oil extraction, transportation and storage. Mining organizations shall observe the following measures: (a) notification to state executive bodies of oil pollution; (b) prevention of oil pollution and oil outflow; and (c) functional maintenance of oil outflow detection devices and equipment. The competent authority shall plan for the mitigation of consequences of oil outflow by: (a) stopping the oil outflow; (b) collecting and removing spilled oil; and (c) storing spilled oil for future recycling.

Policy_Content: This Decree states that the list of objects that technical specifications and permissible limit of emission are applied shall be compiled according to the category of hazardousness of these objects. The facilities shall be categorized in 4 level based on the amount, number and concentration level of hazardous substances. First category includes large-scale enterprises in energy, mining and construction sectors. Second category includes some enterprises in energy, mining, construction, automotive sector and shipbuilding and cotton industries. Third category includes some enterprises in automotive and transport sector, shipbuilding industry as well as large-scale enterprises in food sector. Fourth category includes some enterprises in food, transport and service sector.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Beach Authority Act 2002 (No. 7 of 2002).
Policy_Content: The Beach Authority, established under section 5 as a body corporate for purposes of this Act, shall be to ensure proper control and management of public beaches in Mauritius and Rodrigues, i.e. a space along the coast which, by notice published in the Gazette, has been declared to be a public beach by the Minister responsible for the subject of housing and lands. This space includes an area between the low water mark and the high water mark, and also the surrounding waters up to a distance of 100 meters. The Authority shall implement projects relating to the conservation and protection of the environment of public beaches, the enhancement of the quality of sea water and other specified objectives, regulate use and management of public beaches and advise the Minister on all matters relating to the management and development of public beaches. Policy: Malawi Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper, April 2002.
Policy_Content: The Malawi Poverty Reduction Strategy (MPRS) is the overarching strategy that will form the basis for all future activities by all stakeholders, including Government. The overall goal of the MPRS is to achieve “sustainable poverty reduction through empowerment of the poor”. Rather than regarding the poor as helpless victims of poverty in need of hand-outs and passive recipients of trickle-down growth, the MPRS sees them as active participants in economic development. The MPRS also emphasizes prioritization and action. The MPRS is built around four pillars. These pillars are the main strategic components grouping the various activities and policies into a coherent framework for poverty reduction. Pillar 1 promotes rapid sustainable pro-poor economic growth and structural transformation; Pillar 2 enhances human capital development; Pillar 3 improves the quality of life of the most vulnerable; Pillar 4 promotes good governance. The MPRS also mainstreams key cross cutting issues such as HIV/AIDS, gender, environment, and science and technology. Higher education institutions will introduce programmes in non-traditional subjects such as science and technology, gender, food security, human rights, biodiversity and HIV/AIDS, among others. This will involve the establishment of adequate research centres that would be addressing emergent development issues, providing grants to graduate students so that they participate in teaching undergraduate courses and as research assistants (pag. 55).

Policy_Content: This Law, in accordance with Article 94 of the Constitution of Georgia and the Law of Georgia on the Basic Principles of the System of Fees, defines the types and rates, and the procedure and deadlines for the payment of the fees set for registration as established by law. Policy: Law No. 49 on production sharing agreements in the process of subsoil management.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal grounds for the relations originating from prospecting, exploration and mining of minerals by Kyrgyz nationals and foreigners in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan. It regulates relations in the process of conclusion, fulfilment and cessation of production sharing agreements and lays down terms and conditions for the aforesaid agreements. Relations originating from prospecting, exploration, mining of minerals, production sharing, and also transportation, processing, storage thereof shall be regulated by production sharing agreement concluded in accordance with the present Law. The Act consists of three Sections divided into 26 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) conclusion and fulfilment of production sharing agreements; and (3) conclusive provisions. Terms and conditions of subsoil management shall conform to the national legislation. The parties of production sharing agreement shall be Kyrgyz government on one side and national and foreign natural and legal persons investing in prospecting, exploration and extraction of minerals. The period of validity of production sharing agreement shall be established autonomously by the parties but shall not exceed 10 years.

Policy: Order No. 160 of the Minister of Environment validating the Regulation on state environmental monitoring.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the state environmental monitoring shall regulate the modalities of organization, implementation and control of performance of environmental monitoring. The provisions of this Order shall be mandatory for all public and private organizations. The specific procedure (location, indicators, periodicity and methods) are stated in the Methodological Instructions on state environmental monitoring. State monitoring shall be considered a set of systematic observations over the state of environment, its components, assessment and forecast of anthropogenic impact on environment. The Ministry of Environment shall be responsible for the organization of environmental monitoring that shall be performed by state bodies, scientific research organizations, and also by legal entities that collect data and information on the state of environment. State environmental protection laboratories shall be authorized to perform laboratory testing and measurements of environment and sources of its pollution.  Environmental monitoring program determines: (a) environmental monitoring structure; (b) environmental monitoring plans; (c) assessment criteria; (d) financing; and (e) progress of the program.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 86/2002 updating the legal regime for agricultural waterworks, approved by Decree-Law No. 269/82.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 107 articles divided into eleven Chapters, aims to update the legal regime for agricultural waterworks, approved by Decree-Law No. 269/82 on three fundamental axes: 1. ensuring the use of the works for the purposes for which they were built; 2. respecting the integrity of the hydro-agricultural perimeters; and 3. establishing an appropriate management model. Waterworks are classified into the following four groups: Group I - works of national interest aiming at a profound transformation of the agricultural exploitation conditions of a vast region; Group II - works of regional interest with high interest for the agricultural development of the region; Group III - works of local interest with a high collective impact; Group IV - other collective works of local interest.

Policy: Regional Forest Agreements Act 2002.
Policy_Content: The main objects of this Act are: (a) to give effect to certain obligations of the Commonwealth under Regional Forest Agreements; (b) to give effect to certain aspects of the Forest and Wood Products Action Agenda and the National Forest Policy Statement; (c) to provide for the existence of the Forest and Wood Products Council. "Regional Forest Agreement " (RFA) is defined in section 2 as an agreement between the Commonwealth and States regarding forest management and conservation issued specified in the definition. Part 3 of the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999 and provisions of other Acts specified in section 6 do not apply to an RFA forestry operation that is undertaken in accordance with an RFA. Other provisions of this Act concern termination of an RFA or compensation of breach by the Commonwealth, information and tabling of RFA's. The Minister of the Commonwealth shall ensure that a Forest and Wood Products Council exists at all times. The Council shall be a forum by which the Minister and stakeholders in the forest and wood products industry may consult, exchange advice and otherwise cooperate regarding RFA's.

Policy: Land Use Planning Code.
Policy_Content: This Code grants every citizen the right to a favourable environment ensured by sound land use planning through: (a) state regulation of land use planning activities; (b) planning of urban land; (c) compensation for damages resulting from violation of land use planning legislation; and (d) liability. Land use planning activities shall be specially regulated for the following types of land: (a) land affected by natural or technological disasters; (b) land contaminated by chemical or biological agents, harmful microorganisms or excessive concentrations of radioactive substances; and (c) protected areas. Contaminated land shall be subject to mandatory special treatment. On territories and urban land pertaining to protected areas, hazardous economic or other activities shall be prohibited. Urban land shall be the competence of local self-government bodies, which shall manage the land in accordance with general land use plans. Damages caused to legal or natural persons by the infringement of land use planning legislation as a result of land expropriation shall be subject to compensation.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 214 validating the Regulation on state evaluation of land use planning documentation.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities by which the state shall evaluate land use planning documentation for compliance with the technical requirements and terms and conditions of land use planning. The Federal Land Cadastre Service shall evaluate the following land use planning documentation: (a) general land use planning schemes of the territory of the Russian Federation; (b) land use planning documentation elaborated by governmental bodies; (c) documentation related to federal land. Favourable evaluations must contain an expert opinion on the land use plan documentation’s compliance with the technical requirements and terms and conditions of land use planning. Unfavourable evaluations must contain an expert opinion as to the impossibility of carrying out the land use plan as documented.

Policy: Governmental Emergency Ordinance No. 43 validating the Regulation on the National Anti-Corruption Division.
Policy_Content: National Anti-Corruption Division is and independent institution in relation to the courts and the prosecutor's offices attached thereto, as well as in relations with other public authorities, exercising their duties only in accordance with the law and to ensure compliance with acting legislation. National Anti-Corruption Division shall perform the following functions: (a) criminal investigation, under the conditions provided in the Code of Criminal Procedure for the prevention, detection and sanctioning of acts of corruption; (b) conducting, supervising and controlling investigations carried out at the request of the prosecutor by the judicial police officers under the exclusive authority of the Chief Prosecutor of the National Anti-Corruption Division; (c) management, supervision and control of the activities of technical aspects of criminal investigation, carried out by specialists in the economic field, financial, banking, customs, IT, as well as in other fields within the framework of the National Anti-Corruption Division; (d) participation, in accordance with the law, in court hearings; (e) elaboration of the annual report regarding the activity of the National Anti-Corruption Division and its presentation to the Superior Council of Magistracy and the Minister of Justice; (f) establishment and updating database in the field of corruption; and (g) exercising other functions assigned thereto by law.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 111 validating the Regulation on state environmental monitoring.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that state environmental monitoring shall be the system of regular observations of environmental pollution and processes having negative environmental impact and use of natural resources with a view of identification of environmental pollution level, assessment of the state thereof, forecasting and mitigation of the consequences of negative environmental impact. Objects of environmental monitoring shall be biotic and abiotic components of environment, and also technological and natural factors of negative environmental impact. State environmental monitoring shall be composed of: (a) monitoring of emissions; (b) monitoring of atmospheric pollution; (c) monitoring of water pollution – surface water and groundwater; (d) monitoring of hazardous natural and technological processes; (e) monitoring of soil pollution; and (f) noise pollution.

Policy: Regional Law No. 691-OD “On functioning of land reclamation complex”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that land reclamation arrangements shall be carried out with a view of raising crop productivity and yield, ensuring stable production of agricultural commodities through conservation of agro-landscapes and raising soil fertility, and also for involvement into agricultural production of low-yielding agricultural land, use of waterbodies for potable water supply, water abstraction for public water supply, fishfarming and other purposes. Planning of land reclamation arrangements shall be carried out by the authorized state body in the sphere of land reclamation. Land reclamation shall be carried out in compliance with sanitary, ecological and other standards, rules and regulations. Land reclamation arrangements must not lead to environmental deterioration and degradation. Reclaimed land shall be subject to systematic monitoring.

Policy: Administrative Order No. 8 S. 2002 on Rules and Regulations for the Importation and Release into the Environment of Plants and Plant Products derived from the Use of Modern Biotechnology.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Order, consisting of 22 sections  divided into seven Parts, regulates the Importation and Release into the Environment of Plants and Plant Products derived from the Use of Modern Biotechnology. This Order covers the importation or release into the environment of: 1. Any plant which has been altered or produced through the use of modern biotechnology if the donor organism, host organism, or vector or vector agent belongs to any of the genera or taxa classified by BPI as meeting the definition of plant pest or is a medium for the introduction of noxious weeds; or 2. Any plant or plant product altered or produced through the use of modern biotechnology which may pose significant risks to human health and the environment based on available scientific and technical information. This Order shall not apply to the contained use of a regulated article, which is within the regulatory supervision of NCBP. No regulated article shall be allowed to be imported or released into the environment without a related risk assessment, which shall be carried out in a scientifical and transparent manner based on available scientific and technical information. Specific principles shall be followed when performing a risk assessment to determine whether a regulated article poses significant risks to human health and the environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Administrative Order enters into force 30 days after its publication.

Policy_Content: This Decree provides criteria for judging if a project for the restructuring of polluted soil must be carried out completely by its owner/polluter, or a limited restructuring which allows isolation and control of the pollution suffices. Policy: Order No. 72 of the Federal Service on Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring regarding amendments and addenda to the Regulation on the modalities of the organization and carrying out state supervision over activity causing active impact on meteorological and other geophysical processes.
Policy_Content: The following items of the Regulation must be amended. Item 2.1.1 of the paragraph 2 acquires a new wording that reads as follows: “Inspection must be carried out in accordance with planned schedule and envisages the analysis of the activity of the juridical person authorized to carry out activity of active impact on meteorological and other geophysical processes as regards the fulfilment of licensing conditions and requirements, instructions and norms regulating the aforesaid work. Inspection must be carried out to the extent envisaged by ordinances of ROSHYDROMET, its territorial branches and subordinate organizations (in accordance with the form adduced in the Annex 3). Inspection regarding a single juridical person can be carried out no more than once in two years.” Item 2.1.2 of the paragraph 2 acquires a new wording that reads as follows: “Extraordinary inspection of work done is carried out for the purpose of removal of the violations exposed by in the process of inspection. Extraordinary arrangements for inspection of work done are also carried out on receiving information from juridical persons, individual business undertakers and state institutions regarding violation of technological processes or application of new methods and means of active impact that had not passed environmental audit.”

The supply of water in a command area shall be in the following manner, namely: (a) simultaneously to all lands if the water is sufficient to coup the whole command area at a time; (b) on turn basis beginning from the land nearest to the source if the water is insufficient to coup the water command area at a time. Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 383 on allotment of standing timber.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation shall be applicable to public forest and it establishes the modalities of allotment of standing timber, allotment of cutting areas and transfer thereof to forest managers for the purpose of timber extraction. Timber extraction shall be carried out in case of main, intermediate and other felling. In the forests of protected areas shall be authorized shall be authorized exclusively intermediate and sanitary felling, while in forest reserves shall be authorized only sanitary felling. In case of main felling shall be allotted standing timber damaged by forest fires, infected by pests, polluted timber, undercut, mature and overmature timber growing on land destined for land clearing. Timber extraction of the following forest species shall be prohibited: (a) durmast oak (Quercus petraea); (b) common silver fir (Abies alba); (c) basswood (Tilia); (d) Bosnian maple (Acer platanoides); (e) elm (Ulmus); (f) beech (Fagus); (g) Karelian birch; (h) cedar (Cedrus); (i) larch (Larix); (j) yellow fir; (k) willow (Salix); (l) yellow rhododendron; (m) cotoneaster; (n)  plum (Prunus); (o) genista. The above-mentioned species can be authorized only for sanitary felling. Timber extraction and logging shall be authorized only in the presence of felling licence and forestry licence.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Petroleum Management Regulations (N.S. Reg. 44/2002).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Environment Act. The Regulations lay down provisions relating to the environmentally safe practice for the storage of petroleum products. Petroleum tanks are used on the farm to store gasoline and diesel fuel. Properly designed petroleum storages must prevent leaks and the potential contamination of soils, surface water or groundwater. In particular, section 4 establishes that for the purpose of the present Regulations, “petroleum products” are designated as dangerous goods. The text – consisting of 27 sections – deals, amongst others, with the following aspects: application, general requirements, bulk plant, release causing adverse effect, supervision of transfer, overflow causing adverse effect, spill requirements, storage tank registration, installer certificate of qualification, storage tank system monitoring, record keeping, leakage and abandonment of storage tank system.

Policy: Plant Health (Forestry) (Great Britain) (Amendment) (No. 2) Order 2002  (S.I. No. 927 of 2002).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Plant Health (Forestry) (Great Britain) Order 1993 so as to implement certain elements of Commission Directives 2002/29/EC and 2002/28/EC in Great Britain which are not implemented in other legislation. Directive 2002/29/EC amends the protected zones established under Council Directive 2000/29/EC ("the principal Plant Health Directive") and scheduled in the Annex to Commission Directive 2001/32/EC. Directive 2002/28/EC provides for consequential amendments to certain Annexes of the principal Plant Health Directive. The amendment to the protected zones implemented by this Order concerns the removal of the protected zone in Corsica in respect of the pest Matsucoccus feytaudi Duc. (art. 2(3)). An additional amendment is made to the definition of Council Directive 2000/29/EC so as to incorporate amendments made to it by Commission Directive 2002/28/EC (art. 2(2)).

Policy: Directive 2002/30/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of rules and procedures with regard to the introduction of noise-related operating restrictions at Community airports.
Policy_Content: The objectives pursued by this Directive are the following: (a) to lay down Community rules to facilitate the introduction of operating restrictions in a consistent manner at airport level with a view to limiting or reducing the number of people significantly affected by the harmful effects of noise; (b) to promote development of airport capacity in harmony with the environment; (c) to facilitate the achievement of specific noise abatement objectives at the level of individual airports. Article 4 lays down general provisions in matter of aircraft noise management. Member States shall adopt a balanced approach in dealing with noise problems at airports in their territory. Policy: Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food (Dissolution) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 794 of 2002).
Policy_Content: This Order in Council, made under the Ministers of the Crown Act 1975, dissolves the Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food, transfers its functions in general to the Secretary of State, and transfers its property, rights and liabilities in general to the Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs. Article 2 dissolves the Ministry. It also transfers to the Secretary of State the functions of the Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food and transfers joint functions, where exercised by that Minister with the Secretary of State at large, to the Secretary of State. However, if a function is exercisable jointly with a named Secretary of State, the Minister's share of the function is transferred to the Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs. Article 3 provides for specific transfers in cases where the formulas in article 2 are not to apply. Article 4 provides for the transfer of property, rights and liabilities, and for the designation of the Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs as Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food to the extent required for the continued holding of foreign property. Article 5, Schedule 1 and Schedule 2 provide for amendments of, and repeals and revocations to, legislation in consequence of articles 2 and 3. Article 6 makes supplementary provision including provision for continuity in relation to the exercise of transferred functions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Lower Saxony Forestry and Landscape Law.
Policy_Content: With a view to achieve a sustainable development, the purpose of the present Law is to conserve forests because of its economic utility, its importance for the environment, and in particular as living space for wild living animals and wild growing plants, for the climate, water resources, pollution of the air, fertility of the soil, the image of the country, the agriculture on the whole and its infrastructure and, finally, because of its importance for recreational purposes of the public. Furthermore, a harmonization between the interests of the forest owners and the interest of the public shall be achieved. The text consists of 50 articles divided into 9 Parts as follows: Purpose of the Law, definition of terms, co-operation (I); Forestry frame work planning (II); Conservation of forests, afforestation, forestry management and development (III); Administration of public and private forests (IV); Measures against forest fires and forest damages (V); Right to access to the free countryside (VI); Rules of conduct in the free countryside (VII); Recreational paths (VIII); Final provisions (IX).

Policy: Law on transmission of electric power, regulator and system operator of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Law shall be to ensure continuous supply of electricity at defined quality standards. The Law establishes the State Electricity Regulatory Commission (SERC), having jurisdiction and responsibility over transmission of electricity, transmission system operations and foreign trade in electricity in accordance with international norms in harmony with European Union standards. The scope of SERC’s jurisdiction and authority shall include: (a) issuance, modification, suspension, revocation, monitoring of and enforcing compliance with licences pertaining to transmission of electric energy; (b) issuing of rules and regulations in the sphere of electric energy; and (c) issuance of annual reports and other public information about SERC. Criteria for obtaining a licence: (a) the safety and security of the transmission networks, installations and associated equipment; (b) protection of public health and safety; (c) protection of the environment; (d) land use and siting; (e) energy sufficiency.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Less Favoured Area Support Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2002 (S.S.I. No. 139 of 2002).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision for the purposes of implementation of Council Regulation (EC) No. 1257/1999 on support for rural development from the European Agricultural Guidance and Guarantee Fund and Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1750/1999 laying down detailed rules for the application of Council Regulation No. 1257/1999. They apply to holdings in respect of which the Scottish Ministers are the competent authority under the Integrated Administration and Control System Regulations 1993. Applications for less favoured area support are to be made to the Scottish Ministers; eligibility for payment of support is dependent upon the applicant meeting the criteria set out in regulation 4. It can only be paid to an applicant who carries out an eligible agricultural activity (defined in regulation 2) on eligible land (defined in regulation 6). No payment will be made where the amount of eligible land is less than 3 hectares (regulation 5). Support is paid for eligible hectares on farms in Scottish less favoured areas at specified rates. There is provision at regulation 6(6) to allow Scottish Ministers to determine the total number of livestock units where an applicant has not been able to achieve the minimum stocking density because of slaughter in consequence of foot and mouth disease.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Development Law (2002)
Policy_Content: The Law provides for regional development in Latvia. Its purpose is to promote and ensure balanced and sustainable development of the State, taking into account special features and opportunities of the entire State territory and of separate parts thereof, to reduce the unfavourable differences among them, as well as to preserve and develop the features characteristic of the natural and cultural environment of each territory and the development potential thereof. Regional development support measures are a programme and a set of relevant projects to be implemented in order to attain the objectives of this Law. A planning region is a derived public person. Its decision-taking institution is the Planning Region Development Council. The Cabinet shall determine the territories of the planning regions in accordance with proposals submitted by local governments. The planning regions are Kurzeme Planning Region, Latgale Planning Region, Rīga Planning Region, Vidzeme Planning Region and Zemgale Planning Region.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 26.556 - Aprueba la Estrategia Nacional de Conservación y Uso Sostenible de la Biodiversidad.
Policy_Content: La Estrategia Nacional de Conservación y Uso Sostenible de la Biodiversidad es un instrumento sectorial de alcance nacional y con un horizonte temporal de diez años, cuyo objetivo estratégico es desarrollar el potencial económico de la diversidad biológica del país, asegurando la conservación y el uso sostenible de los ecosistemas, especies y recursos genéticos, contribuyendo así al desarrollo sostenible nacional  y a mejorar la calidad de vida de la población. La Estrategia viene acompañada de un Plan de Acción, que contempla cinco áreas de intervención: 1) Conservación de ecosistemas, Especies y Recursos Genéticos de Importancia Ecológica, Económica y Cultural; 2) Atracción de inversiones en productos y servicios ambientales de la biodiversidad; 3) Fortalecimiento de capacidades nacionales para la gestión de la biodiversidad; 4) Fortalecimiento de la gestión local en la conservación y uso sostenible de la biodiversidad; 5) Educación, sensibilización, difusión y control social para la gestión sostenible de la biodiversidad. El Plan abarca 22 programas y 125 líneas de proyectos.

Policy_Content: This Decree establishes essential requirements for aerosol flacons, modalities of enforcement thereof, and also the modalities of labelling aerosol flacons. It shall be applicable to aerosol flacons with total contents shall be no less than 50 ml and shall not exceed 1,000 ml for metal falcons, 220 ml for protected glass flacons and plastic flacons that in case of explosion can produce fragments, and 150 ml for unprotected glass and plastic flacons. Distribution on the national territory of aerosol flacons not complying with this Decree shall be prohibited. Aerosol flacons shall be marked with “э” (reversed epsilon).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Arrêté du 18 mars 2002 relatif aux émissions sonores dans l'environnement des matériels destinés à être utilisés à l'extérieur des bâtiments.
Policy_Content: Les dispositions du présent arrêté sont applicables aux matériels destinés à être utilisés à l'extérieur des bâtiments, définis à l'annexe I et considérés comme entités complètes prêtes à l'emploi, à l'exclusion : - des accessoires sans moteur, à l'exception des brise-béton et des marteaux-piqueurs à main et des brise-roche hydrauliques ; - de tous les matériels principalement destinés au transport de marchandises ou de personnes par route, rail, air ou voies d'eau ; - des matériels spécialement conçus et construits à l'usage de l'armée ou de la police ainsi que pour les services d'urgence. Ces matériels ne peuvent être mis sur le marché, mis en service ou utilisés que si le fabricant ou son mandataire établi dans la Communauté garantit que : - ledit matériel satisfait aux exigences du présent arrêté en matière d'émissions sonores dans l'environnement ; - la procédure d'évaluation de la conformité prévue à l'article 4 a été appliquée ; - le matériel porte le marquage « CE » et l'indication du niveau de puissance acoustique garanti, tels que définis à l'article 8, et est accompagné d'une déclaration de conformité CE.

Policy: Ordonnance Souveraine n° 15.298 modifiant l'ordonnance souveraine n° 13.634 du 25 septembre 1998, modifiée, portant création d'une Direction de l'Environnement, de l'Urbanisme et de la Construction.
Policy_Content: L'article 2 de l'ordonnance n° 13.634 du 25 septembre 1998 portant création d'une Direction de l'Environnement, de l'Urbanisme et de la Construction, est abrogé et remplacé par les dispositions suivantes: "Cette Direction est chargée: - de la préparation et de l'application de la législation et de la réglementation en matière d'environnement; - des études, de la réglementation et du suivi des problèmes liés aux risques naturels majeurs; - du contrôle du respect des lois et règlements en matière d'environnement, d'urbanisme et de construction; - de la promotion, de la coordination et du suivi visant à protéger l'environnement, à le gérer et à réduire l'impact sur lui des activités humaines; - de la surveillance de la qualité du milieu et des sources de pollutions : investigations sur les sources de nuisances sonores ; études de leur impact sur l'environnement ; observation et analyse des rejets, directs et indirects, tant dans l'atmosphère que les cours d'eau et dans le milieu marin; - de l'instruction des projets de constructions publiques ou privées et de la délivrance des autorisations de construire; - de recueillir tous les éléments d'appréciation, notamment dans le cadre de l'esthétique et de l'intégration dans le site, sur tous les projets de constructions publiques ou privées; - de la tenue et de la mise à jour des plans topographiques de la Principauté; - de l'élaboration des plans parcellaires, de la mise à jour des limites de propriétés entre les domaines publics et privés; - de la délivrance des numéros de voirie et des extraits de la matrice cadastrale; - de toutes autres missions qui viendraient à lui être confiées par la voie législative ou réglementaire".

Policy: Ley Nº 423 - Ley General de Salud.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto tutelar el derecho que tiene toda persona de disfrutar, conservar y recuperar su salud, en armonía con lo establecido en las disposiciones legales y normas especiales. Para tal efecto regulará: 1) Los principios, derechos y obligaciones con relación a la salud; 2) Las acciones de promoción, prevención, recuperación y rehabilitación de la salud; 3) El Saneamiento del medio ambiente; 4) El Control sanitario que se ejercerá sobre los productos y servicios destinados a la salud; 5) Las medidas administrativas, de seguridad y de emergencias que aplicará el Ministerio de Salud; 6) La definición de las infracciones y su correspondiente sanción. El Ministerio de Salud es el órgano competente para aplicar, supervisar, controlar y evaluar el cumplimiento de la presente Ley y su Reglamento; así como para elaborar, aprobar, aplicar, supervisar y evaluar normas técnicas, formular políticas, planes, programas, proyectos, manuales e instructivos que sean necesarios para su aplicación. Entre las Competencias y Atribuciones del Ministerio de Salud, está: "Implementar la política de seguridad alimentaria nutricional de la población y las medidas necesarias para complementar la dieta con micro nutriente, cuando sea procedente, de acuerdo con las normas nacionales e internacionales." (Artículo 7º)
